loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BADEGNA   est constitué de 5 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4éme prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  chaussures à l’image de DOUSSOU qui est la 1ére femme assise   dans la photos de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 100 paires de chaussures de toutes sorte avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group "BADEGNA" comprises five married women, who average 40 years of age and three children each. The women live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers, and sons in the MASSABLACOURA district of Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity for improved business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth loan. The three past loans were correctly repaid.

This group of women does commerce in shoes, as does DOUSSOU, who is the woman sitting first from the right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase 100 pairs of shoes of all kinds from Bamako wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales retail essentially to women customers. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be invested in business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase  shoes

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N'TORLA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz avec Mme  KADIATOU  debout au milieu sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0.5 ha. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "BENKADI IV" are married women, who average 41 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in N'TORLA, a village in SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry  out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with Ms. KADIATOU, who is standing in the middle in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing, seeds, and fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village, in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 75,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan tiene 28 años de edad y es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que cada día se esfuerza mucho para poder llevar dinero para solventar los gastos de su hogar, por ello trabaja como obrero en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día, pero cuando es época de siembre en ocasione trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día, Juan cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable.

Juan está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción para realizar mejoras en su habitación como cambio de techo, colocación de pisos, entre otros, así el podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su  más grande sueño:” Tener una casa propia de material noble”
texts.en:
Juan, 28, is a young man with a great desire to succeed.  He really strives every day to be able to bring in money for household expenses. He works as a field laborer on a farm in his city for around 9 hours a day.  However, during the planting season he sometimes works around 10 hours.  He believes he's getting ahead because he is very responsible.

Juan really appreciates the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to buy construction materials to make improvements on his house, like replacing the roof, putting in floors, etc.  He'll also be able to improve his quality of life and continue fighting to be able to realize his biggest dream: to have his own house made from high quality materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to be able to provide assistance for her coffee crops

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 28 years old and comes from Olkalou. She is married to David who produces some additional income for the family,  and they have one child aged 7 years.

Pauline runs a boutique which has been in operation for the past one year. To enable her to stock it well with beauty products, shoes, clothes, handbags and jewellery, she has applied for her second loan of Kshs. 20,000 from Kadet Ltd.

Her monthly income at present is Kshs.20,000. She intends to use the anticipated profit from her expanded business for educating her child and to also start another business for more income. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to become a prominent business lady in her area.

loans.use: To buy stock like shoes, clothes, jewellery, handbags and beauty products for her boutique shop

loans.name: And Siggil Hann 21 Group

texts.fr: L’Association And Siggil Hann regroupe plusieurs femmes ressortissant de l’une des banlieues  Dakaroises. Au départ elles se fréquentaient   a travers des  tontines  hebdomadaires  qui leur permettaient de s’autofinancer pour soutenir leurs activités génératrices de revenus .Actuellement l’association vient de signer un partenariat avec l’UIMCEC dans le cadre du renforcement du pouvoir économique des femmes  pour les aider  a mieux gérer leurs activités et lutter contre la pauvreté. De ce fait And Siggil Hann 21  est un groupe mixte de  7 membres  qui habitent le même quartier et évolue dans le meme secteur d'activité.  Ils sont représentés par madame Adji, femme mariée qui  évolue dans le secteur du commerce et  pratique depuis plus de   35  ans  la  vente de poissons. Elle démarre chaque jour sa journée  de travail a  6  heures du matin pour descendre a  15  heures l’après midi. Les bénéfices que lui procure son activité lui permettent de participer a la dépense quotidienne de son foyer et de supporter les paiements de factures. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de poissons  destinés  a la vente. Elle souhaite développer davantage son activité de commerce,  augmenter les bénéfices qu’elle réalise, renforcer le niveau de son épargne et mieux participer a l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son projet futur consiste a acquérir sa propre maison.
texts.en:
The association "And Siggil Hann" comprises several women citizens from a suburb of Dakar. At first, they used to associate with one another through weekly tontine meetings enabling them to finance themselves to support their revenue-generating businesses. Today, the association just signed a partnership with the microfinance institution U-IMCEC to bolster the women's economic power in order to help them manage their businesses better and to fight poverty.

To this end, "And Siggil Hann 21" is a mixed group of seven members who live in the same district and who work in the same business sector. They are represented by Ms. Adji, who is a married woman working in commerce. She has been selling fish for over 35 years. Her workday starts at 6 AM and ends at 3 PM. The profits she brings in from her business enable her to help cover day-to-day household expenses and to pay the bills.

Ms. Adji is a member of a U-IMCEC branch, where she is requesting a loan from purchasing fish to resell. She would like to develop her business further, increase the profits she makes, bolster her savings, and do more to improve her family's food situation. Her future plans include acquiring her own house.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Idania De Fatima

texts.es: Doña Idania, actualmente habita en casa de su madre junto a sus dos hijos de las edades de 14 y 11 años, ella se desempeña como regente de farmacia y con sus ingresos apoya para la educación de sus hijos y gastos del hogar. Solicita este crédito porque tiene la necesidad de ampliar la cocina de la casa, la cual es muy incómodo, no presta las condiciones sanitarias, con este financiamiento comprara materiales como cemento, arena, hierro, bloques y láminas de zinc para empezar la obra. De esta manera ella y su familia podrán vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Idania lives in her mother's home together with her two children, aged 14 and 11. She works as a manager at a pharmacy and her income helps with the education of her children and the household expenses. She is asking for this loan because they need to make the kitchen larger. It is very inconvenient and not sanitary. Idania will buy cement, sand, re-bar, cinder blocks and zinc sheeting with this loan. By doing this her and her family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, re-bar, cinder blocks and zinc sheeting.

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es:
En el balneario San Clemente en Portoviejo  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son  visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, su gastronomía es muy variada y deliciosa.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 20 y 15 años, el mayor de sus hijos es discapacitado y el menor estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Carmen con su esposo se dedican a la venta de larvas de camarón, para lo cual cuentan con un laboratorio donde ellos cultivan y alimentan estas larvas para luego llevarlas a vender a camaroneras tanto dentro de la ciudad como  fuera de ellas, es un proceso un tanto delicado ya que ellos compran los huevecillos del camarón y en su laboratorio los van incubando y  alimentando para que tengan un buen desarrollo, llevan más de 15 años en este negocio y les va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar larvas de camarón y alimento para que estos tengan un buen desarrollo. Está en el Banco Comunal 5 años y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the spa town of San Clemente en Portoviejo, every 15 days, the 1st of December Community Bank meets. This place is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited by many domestic and foreign tourists. Its gastronomy is very varied and delicious.

In this place lives Carmen who is 43 years old. She is married and from this relationship she has two children who are 20 and 15 years old. The eldest of her children is handicapped and the youngest studies in high school. Her husband is a merchant.

Carmen, with her husband, is dedicated to selling shrimp larvae for which they have a laboratory where they cultivate and feed the larvae to later take them to sell shrimp as much within the city as outside. It is a delicate process since they buy the little shrimp eggs and incubate them in their laboratory and feed them so they develop well. They have 15 years experience in this business and it is going well.

This loan is to buy shrimp larvae and food so they can have good development. She has been in the community bank for five years and she likes it because the interest is very low. Her dream is to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy shrimp larvae and food.

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N'TORLA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz avec Mme MAMA deuxième en position assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0.5 ha. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "BENKADI III" are married women, who average 41 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in N'TORLA, a village in SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry  out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with Ms. MAMA, who is sitting second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing, seeds, and fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village, in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 70,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 29-year-old, married man. He has one child who is two months old. He describes himself to be focused. 

George operates a transport business where he transports customers, using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate  capital. 

George will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy spare parts to service his motorbike and to expand the hotel business for his wife. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have a successful business and family. This is his second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service his motorbike and to expand the hotel business for his wife.

loans.name: Diana Rocio

texts.es:
Diana Duarte es estudiante de Campoalto del primer semestre, es madre cabeza de hogar de dos hijos, uno de 17 años y otro de 4 años, el mayor ya se graduó del bachillerato pero por motivos económicos no pudo entrar a la universidad por lo cual en este momento se encuentra en la casa, el menor ya está en el jardín. Diana debe responder económicamente por ambos y trabaja por días en casas de familia o cuidando adultos mayores, pero son empleos muy esporádicos;  ella y sus dos hijos viven en un apartamento arrendado, sin muchos lujos porque con los ingresos de Diana apenas tienen para cumplir con los gastos de la casa y se deben limitar de muchas cosas y sacrificar otras. En este momento su mayor expectativa es salir adelante y brindarles una mayor calidad de vida a sus hijos y a ella misma por medio de la educación y la profesionalización.
 
Además de sus hijas Diana debe ayudarle a su madre que tiene 56 años y también es auxiliar de enfermería del SENA pero por la edad, los prejuicios sociales y los protocolos de algunas instituciones ya no la reciben en ningún trabajo, afortunadamente ella está a cargo de los dos niños mientras Diana sale a trabajar y a estudiar. 

Diana es un ejemplo de superación y de esfuerzo, ella ha salido sola, en medio de las adversidades, hace tres años se separó por maltrato intrafamiliar por lo cual no volvió a comunicarse con el padre de sus hijos ni siquiera para la parte económica que por ley le correspondería, él no trabaja y ella no quiere exponer a su familia a ese tipo de experiencias por lo cual decidió seguir sola. Por toda esta situación considera que una ayuda para su programa en Campoalto le brindaría un respiro a su apretada situación económica y podría colaborarle a su hijo mayor para los gastos de la Universidad que comienza en el mes de junio. 

Campoalto le ha dado a Diana  la oportunidad de estudiar y en este momento sus notas son sobresalientes, espera seguir así durante toda la carrera hasta su graduación que espera obtener con honores.
texts.en:
Diana Duarte is a first semester student at Campoalto. She is the mother of two children aged 17 and 4 years old. The oldest has graduated from high school but can't enter university for financial reasons. So he's at home right now. The youngest is in kindergarten. Diana is responsible economically for both of them and works in family's homes or takes care of seniors. But her employment is sporadic. They live in a rented apartment without much luxury. Diana's income barely covers the household expenses so they must limit themselves in many aspects and go without in others. At this time her best prospect to get ahead and offer her family a better quality of life is through the education of both herself and her children. 

Besides her children Diana must also help her mother who is 56 years old. She is also a nursing aide but because of her age, social prejudices and the requirements of some institutions, she has not found any work. Fortunately she takes care of the two children while Diana is working or studying. 

Diana is an example of getting ahead and effort. She has carried on alone in the face of great adversity. Three years ago she separated from her husband for motive of mistreatment. She has not been in communication with the father of her children, not even to claim the economic recompense due to her by law. He does not work and she doesn't want to put her family through this type of experience. So she decided to continue alone. 

Given this whole situation she considers the help offered her for her program at Campoalto, a respite from a difficult economic situation. She can help her son with his expenses at University which begins in June. Campoalto has given her the opportunity to study and at this time her marks are outstanding. She hopes to continue like this during her whole course and graduate with honors.

loans.use: to continue with her second semester of nursing at Campoalto.

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es:
Su nombre es María Fernanda, tiene 18 años y creció en un pequeño municipio cercano a la capital, allí realizó todos sus estudios, la primaria y el bachillerato hasta el grado décimo, el ultimo año lo hizo en otra institución, donde recibió  el grado como bachiller agrícola. Allí mientras realizaba sus estudios colaboró en la alcaldía del pueblo participando en los diferentes eventos que se realizaban allí.
Ya culminado el bachillerato decidió irse a vivir a la capital en busca de nuevas y mejores oportunidades para su vida profesional, para ello quiere estudiar contabilidad financiera; Porqué  representa grandes oportunidades  en el ámbito laboral, lo que descubrió mientras realizaba las actividades con la alcaldía de su pueblo, sabe que estudiar es la mejor inversión que puede hacer y por eso se empeña cada día en ser al mejor en lo que hace. Es te es su primer objetivo en busca de su superación personal y profesional, con el credito pretende culminar su primer semestre.
texts.en: Her name is Maria Fernanda, she is 18 years old and grew up in a small town near the capital. It was there she studied at primary and then high school up until tenth grade. In her final year she studied at another institution where she qualified in agriculture. While she completed her studies there she worked at the town hall, participating in different events that were held there. Having completed her high school studies, she decided to move to the capital in search of new and better opportunities for her professional life. She wants to study financial accountancy, as this represents great opportunities in the workplace, which she discovered while working at the town hall. She knows that studying is the best investment you can make, and therefore strives every day to be the best at what she does. This is her first aim in her personal and professional improvement. With this loan she intends to complete her first semester.

loans.use: to undertake professional technical education in financial accountancy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee plantations.

loans.name: Carol Vanessa

texts.es:
Ella es Carol tiene 5 hermanos y unos padres muy amorosos. Su padre es agricultor y su madre docente.
Su temporada en colegio fue muy agradable conoció a gente muy especial; en el 2010 se gradúo de la secundaria. Sus padres siempre han querido que salga adelante por eso decidieron enviarla a la ciudad de capital a vivir con unos tíos, ya que en el lugar donde nació no hay muchas universidades ni muchas opciones laborales.
Poco después de terminar el colegio trató de ingresar a las universidades públicas pero no fue posible, así que, ese semestre no pudo estudiar ya que las universidades privadas son muy caras y sus padres no están en condiciones de pagar.
Hasta que por medio de una amiga conoció de la corporación, allí encontró una gran oportunidad de pago y de fácil financiación, se matriculó en el programa de contabilidad financiera y empezó a estudiar, con la ayuda de sus padres que con esfuerzos pagaron sus estudios hasta que cumplió la mayoría de edad.  Ya con la edad requerida decidió empezar a trabajar y sus padres la apoyaron ya que reconocían que les quedaba difícil seguir pagando los estudios. Otra amiga suya la recomendó en un call center donde actualmente se encuentro trabajando, reconoce que es muy difícil pero a veces es necesario hacer sacrificios por lo que se quiere; gracias al trabajo que tiene puede pagar sus estudios y suplir sus gastos personales. El tiempo que le queda libre es muy poco, pues estudio medio día y trabaja el resto del día, pero lo disfruta ya que sabe que algún día obtendrá el fruto de su trabajo.
Se considera una persona emprendedora por eso su visión va más adelante, tiene pensado al terminar su carrera técnica hacer la profesional en contaduría y finanzas, ya falta muy poco para eso y se siente muy orgullosa. Se siente feliz de ver que hay organizaciones como KIVA que quieren apoyar e impulsar el desarrollo de la educación superior en el mundo, sobre todo en un país de pocas oportunidades, pero llena de mucha gente como ella que quiere salir adelante .
texts.en:
Carol has 5 brothers and very loving parents.  Her father is a farmer and her mother is a teacher.  Her time in high school was very nice and she met special people.  She graduated from high school in 2010.  Her parents have always wanted her to succeed so they decided to send her to the capital city to live with her aunt and uncle, since it is the birthplace of many universities and there are many job options.

A little after she finished high school, she tried to go to the public universities but it was not possible and that semester she could not study because private universities are very expensive and her parents could not pay for it. She met a friend through the corporation and saw an easy opportunity to finance.  She enrolled in the financial account program and began studying with the help of her parents who paid for her studies until she came of age.    

At the required age, she decided to start working and her parents supported it because they realized it would be difficult to keep paying for her studies. Another friend of hers recommended a call center where she was currently working.  She recognizes it is difficult but sometimes it is necessary to make sacrifices for what you want. Thanks to the work, she can pay for her studies and fulfill personal expenses.  

Her free time is very limited, for she studies half the day and works the rest of the day, but she enjoys it knowing one day she will get the fruits of her labor.  She is considered an entrepreneurial person and because of that her vision goes even further.  She plans to finish her technical career and do the professional accounting finance program.  She is only missing a few things before that point, and is very proud of that. 

She feels happy to see that there are organizations like KIVA that what to support and promote the development of higher education in the world, especially in a country with few opportunities, but full of many people like her who want to get ahead.

loans.use: to get a professional technical education in finance accounting

loans.name: Leitner Brigitte

texts.es:
es Brigitte tiene 26 años felizmente madre cabeza de familia de 2 bellas hijas, la mayor  de 9 años y se encuentra en 4 grado y es un orgullo para ella y la menor de 3 años quien ya se encuentra en el jardín donde se debe pagar una pensión mensual ya que es un jardín de madres comunitarias.
Para Brigitte es muy importante salir adelante ya que el sostenimiento de sus hijas y ella misma le implica sacrificio y mucha fortaleza por tal razón quiere capacitarse intelectualmente ya que es la única manera de tener una mejor calidad de vida para brindarles a sus hijas.
A Brigitte le gustaba mucho el área de la contabilidad hasta que comenzó a laborar con unos abogados penalistas donde tiene un salario mínimo y ya que es madre cabeza de familia debe de pagar sus obligaciones mensuales como son arriendo, servicios, alimentación y jardín de la menor hija. 
Una vez le dieron la oportunidad de laborar en el área de Derecho empezó a interesarse por esta rama la jefe vio en que tenía varias aptitudes y dejó que ella manejara toda la parte administrativa, pero también los procesos penales donde maneja lesiones personales u Homicidios culposos, audiencias y demás, es de ahí donde nace la pasión por el derecho pero como no puede sostener una carrera profesional busco institutos donde dictaran algo judicial hasta que encontró a Campo Alto en el mismo encontró lo que básicamente esperaba, pero por tener todas estas obligaciones sería muy significativo para ella conseguir un financiamiento con el fin de que se pueda capacitar y en dos años poderse graduar y ser un orgullo más que para ella misma para sus hijas quien ven y siguen su ejemplo.
texts.en:
Brigitte is 26 and the happy head of her household with 2 beautiful daughters. The eldest is nine years old and in 4th grade and makes Brigitte very proud. The younger daughter is three years old and is already in school at a community mother's kindergarten, where Brigitte pays a monthly tuition.

It is very important to Brigitte to get ahead so as to support herself and her daughters which has required sacrifice and strength. For that reason she wants to continue her education as it is the only way to offer a better quality of life for her daughters.

Brigitte liked accounting until she started to work with some criminal lawyers and was paid minimum wage.  As the head of household she need to pay her monthly obligations such as rent, services, food and kindergarten for her younger daughter.
Once she was given the opportunity to work in law she became interested in the field. Her boss saw that she had various skills and let her handle all the administrative tasks, but also the criminal cases of personal injury or culpable homicide and hearings among other tasks. 

From this experience she has developed a passion for the field but since she can't sustain a professional career she sought institutions that has legal programs until she found Campo Alto and essentially found what she was looking for. With all of these obligations it would be very significant for her to get a loan so that she could train and in two years graduate and be a source of pride for herself and for her daughters to see and follow her example.

loans.use: spend a semester studying as a legal aide at Campo Alto

loans.name: Lady Johana

texts.es:
LADY como estudiante del programa Arte Gráfico le interesa vincularse en el convenio KIVA para así mejorar en la parte económica y finalizar la carrera como técnico profesional desempeñándose en la parte creativa de su propia empresa o en empresas de diseño, mejorar la productividad económica y de mercadeo, realizando la creación de imagen corporativa, creación y registro  de marca, ilustración, ser parte de los medios publicitarios ya sea vallas, radio, revistas; entre otros.
Ella se proyecta metas a corto, mediano y largo plazo; ella tiene un objetivo claro y es siempre ir hacia adelante  sin importar las barreras, sin rendirse y superarse a sí misma para alcanzar sus metas.
Para ella las metas a corto plazo son; terminar la carrera como técnico profesional en Arte Gráfico y así brindar sus conocimientos e ideas innovadoras en empresas, aportando al desarrollo de productos y/o servicios,con el cumpliendo de las normas legales en el mercado y la publicidad.
Las metas a mediano plazo es continuar con los estudios de tecnología y posteriormente ser profesional en arte gráfico, arte industrial, idiomas, medios audiovisuales; entre otros. 
Las metas a largo plazo es crear su propia empresa de diseño gráfico e ilustración, manejando las capacidades y conocimientos que ella está adquiriendo.
texts.en:
Lady, as a student of graphic design, is interested in taking out a Kiva loan in order to improve her finances and to finish her technical studies. She wants to work in the creative department of her own business or for a design company and improve financial productivity and work in buying and selling by creating images for companies, creating and registering brands, making illustrations, and being involved in billboard, magazine, radio and other types of advertising.

Lady has short, medium and long-term goals.  She has a clear objective and is always moving forwards, regardless of the obstacles she faces.  She does not give up and always beats her own records in order to achieve her aims.

Lady's short-term goals are to finish her studies in graphic design and then help businesses with her knowledge and innovating ideas.  She will help them design products and services while following advertising legal norms.

In the medium-term, she would like to continue with her studies in technology and become a professional in graphic design, industrial art, languages, media and more.

In the long term Lady wants to create her own graphic design and illustrations business, and employ the skills and knowledge that she is currently learning.

loans.use: to pay for studies in graphic design and advertising.

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es: Su nombre es Alejandra tiene 19 años.  Desde pequeña su sueño es ser artista, a pesar de los conflictos armados en que ella ha tenido que vivir junto con su familia, nunca cambió su mentalidad de ser una gran persona superando cualquier dificultad, la vida para ella es una difícil tarea que esta dispuesta a asumir con la fuerza que nace de su alma y con las ganas de ser ejemplo para sus hermanos menores que emprenden esta vida.  Gracias al apoyo que ha recibido por parte de Kiva, ha logrado terminar su primer semestre en el cual aprendió técnicas y evoluciono su manera de dibujar, aportando a sus dotes un concepto de publicidad el cual a futuro le ayudará a obtener mejores oportunidades en el campo laboral. Ya terminó su primer semestre sin ningún problema, con el apoyo de kiva ha reducido los costos en su carrear ya así mismo los gastos a su familia, de igual manera mantenerse al día para seguir adquiriendo los conocimientos de sus profesores y compañeros, hoy en día se va  formando tanto profesional como humanamente y agradece su colaboración, espera terminar sus estudios con méritos y cumplir su sueño de ser una artista. Va por buen camino y con anhelos de seguir. Cuando su gran preocupación de continuar en sus estudios estaba latente, gracias a KIVA siente el alivio de preocuparse por ser la mejor académicamente y su mayor alegría es saber que existen entidades que ayudar a cumplir los sueños de las personas.  En esta oportunidad Alejandra les quiere mostrar una pequeña parte de lo que ha sido su trabajo en el dibujo.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 19 years old. From a young age her dream has been to become an artist, despite the armed conflicts which she has had to live through with her family. Her mentality of being a bigger person overcoming any difficulty has never changed. Life for her is a difficult task that she is ready to tackle with the strength in her soul, wanting to set an example for her younger siblings who are starting out in life.

Thanks to the support she has received from Kiva, she managed to finish her first semester during which she learnt techniques and developed her style of drawing, bringing to her qualities a concept of publicity which in the future will help her to obtain better opportunities in her career. She finished her first semester without any problems, and with the support of Kiva she has reduced the costs of her career, including the costs to her family. Equally, she is keeping up to date in order to continue acquiring knowledge from her professors and classmates. 

Today, she is developing herself both professionally and personally, and she is grateful for this collaboration. She hopes to finish her studies with merit and realize her dream of becoming an artist. She is on the right track and yearning to continue. When her concern about continuing her studies was growing, thanks to Kiva she was relieved from not having to worry about being the best academically and her biggest happiness is knowing that there are organizations that help realize people's dreams. Given this opportunity, Alejandra would like to show you a small example of of her artwork.

loans.use: to pay for her technical and professional education in graphic and advertisement art.

loans.name: Wuendin

texts.es:
Wuendin es una mujer de 31 años de edad ella es ama de casa y agricultora desde muy temprana edad como también es madre de 2 hijos los cuales junto a sus padres se involucran en las diferentes actividades del campo. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria cursado hasta el quinto grado y muchos años de experiencia en la actividad de la siembra de café por medio de sus padres como también a ordeñar vacas ya que tienen algunas las cuales generan por medio de la leche entre otros derivados generar más ingresos para su familia. Sus cultivos de café están a 30 minutos de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente para asistirla en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos.

Sus sueños son los de ampliar más sus cultivos de café sembrando una variedad más atractiva para sus clientes, la cual genere más ingresos como el catuay, caturra, catimora entre otros. Como madre apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios ayudarlos a convertirse en profesionales los cuales puedan con el tiempo enfrentar de manera favorable los problemas económicos entre otros formando un patrimonio digno y sólido. Por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento para la compra de 22 unidades de nutricafe, 12 unidades de abono 18-46-0 y 2 botes de abono foliar para asistir sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Wuendin is a 31 year old woman. She has been a housewife and farmer since a very young age. She is also a mother to two children who, along with her parents, engage in different activities of the countryside. She has a primary school education, finishing the fifth grade, and many years experience in the work of planting coffee through her parents as well as milking cows since she has some which generate from the milk, among other by-products, more income for her family. Her coffee crops are 30 minutes distance from her house, which she crosses on foot daily to tend to in the company of her husband and their children.

Her dreams are to expand her coffee crops more, sowing a more attractive variety for her customers, which will generate more income, like catuay, caturra, catimora, among others. As a mother, to support her children with their education, helping them become professionals who can, with time, face in a favorable manner economic problems, among others forming a solid and worthy heritage. So today she has requested a loan to buy 22 units of nutricafe, 12 units of 18-40-0 fertilizer and 2 cans of foliar fertilizer to help her coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Business Group

texts.fr:
Désiré fait partie du groupe  Business  et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est un célibataire de 28 ans.

Il  fait le commerce des habits depuis  10 ans. 

Il est à son quatorzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter  son capitale et acheter  beaucoup d’habits  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, il  voudrait acheter une parcelle et construire une maison.
texts.en:
Désiré is part of the group "Business" and lives in Bujumbura. He is 28 years old and unmarried.

Désiré has been doing commerce in clothing for ten years.

He is on his 14th loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a lot of clothing to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to purchase a parcel of land and build a house.

loans.use: il  va  augmenter  son capital  et acheter  beaucoup d’habits  à revendre, pour gagner plus.

loans.name: Giovanny Andrés

texts.es: Su nombre es Giovanny Andrés  tiene 21 años y el motivo principal de esta carta es contar su pequeña pero extensa historia, es estudiante de Campoalto Ascesalud, curso en el programa ensamble, programación y mantenimiento de Hardware, le gusta mucho esa carrera y le  motiva a seguir adelante con sus estudios. Ahora en la actualidad  no tiene como sostener a su papá y a el en este momento ninguno de los dos cuentan con trabajo estable, trabaja ocasionalmente en un bar los viernes y trabajo de 11:30 a 3 de la mañana de los sábados, no tiene un sueldo fijo, además de eso su papá trabaja en las noches en un carrito ambulante vendiendo variedad de comestibles empacados, en este momento más que nunca estamos pasando por una situación difícil, a su papá le quitaron su único medio de trabajar algo que suele pasar muy seguido y el necesita continuar sus estudios, no tioene un solvento económico de ninguna índole y por supuesto no quiere perder la oportunidad que con tanto esfuerzo a logrado la de estudiar,  para el desde que salio del colegio en el año 2008  tiene como sueño  convertirse en un gran ingeniero, porque esta seguro que si se estudia se llega muy lejos,y eso es lo que quiere, ser un Gran Ingeniero de sistemas porque es lo que le apasiona, por este motivo no quiero que su esfuerzo sea en vano.
texts.en: His name is Giovanny Andrés. He is 21 years old. The main motive here is to tell his short but extensive story. He is a student at Campoalto Ascesalud, in the Hardware Assembly, Programing and Maintenance program. He likes this profession a lot and this is his motivation to continue on with his studies. At the moment he has no way to support his father, as neither has stable employment now. Giovanny Andrés occasionally works in a bar on Friday nights from 11;30 pm until 3 in the morning. He has no fixed salary. Other than this his father works at night selling a variety of packaged foods from a push cart. They are going though a difficult time. His father lost his only means of working, something which can happen quickly and Giovanny Andrés needs to continue studying. There is no economic resolution of any kind and of course he does not want to lose the opportunity that he has worked so hard for, that is to study. Since he graduated from High School he has dreamed of becoming a great engineer. For sure if he studies he will go far. This is what he wants, to be a great systems engineer. This is his passion and for this reason he doesn't want his efforts to be wasted.

loans.use: to attend his second semester in computer hardware assembly and maintenance.

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
Esta es la historia de un joven adolescente en busca de una educación para su vida laboral, en un país donde no hay muchas oportunidades, muchacho talentoso con una ética y unos valores que han sido inculcados por sus padres y reflejados en la sociedad en donde habita, en estos momentos está estudiando contabilidad financiera y quiere llegar a hacer un gran contador de su país. Esa es su meta entre otras muchas más metas proyectadas en su futuro para lograr esta meta él se dedica a trabajar y a estudiar y en sus tiempos libres realiza otras actividades, es un buen muchacho de muy buena familia pide mucho a Dios para que lo ayude en su camino y así convertirse en un gran empresario, para esto necesita de un apoyo que en ocasiones es difícil conseguirlo puesto que el tiene un hijo y debe responder por él, pero eso a este joven no le ha impedido seguir estudiando pues es lo que más le gusta hacer.  Por este tiempo pasa un momento difícil porque responde por su muchacho o estudia.  

Lo que pasa es que este joven realmente quiere estudiar y no quiere desertar de la universidad pues verdaderamente le apasiona lo que está estudiando y cuando sea un gran empresario quiere apoyar a las mentes en crecimiento, lo que busca este chico es riego para la semilla que representa, con el fin de ser buen fruto en el futuro.
texts.en:
This is the story of a young adolescent in search of an education for his working life.  In a country where there are not many opportunities, he is a talented boy with ethics and values that were instilled by his parents and reflected in the society he lives in.  Right now, he is studying financial accounting and he wants to be a big accountant in his country.  

That is his goal among many other projected goals in his future.  To meet his goal he is devoted to working and studying, and in his free time, he does other activities.  He is a good kid from a good family and asks God to help him on his way to becoming a great businessman. For this he needs support, but at times it is difficult to achieve because he has a son and he must take care of him.  However, he has continued his studying because it is what he likes to do the most. At this time it is difficult because he much choose to care for his son or his studies. 

What happened is that he really wants to study and not leave the university, because he is truly passionate about what he is studying.  When he is a great businessman, he wants to support growing minds.  He is searching for help to water his seed so he can be be a good fruit in the future.

loans.use: to get a professional technical education in finance accounting

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 53-year-old woman. She describes herself to be industrious. 

She operates a sweet potato business where she sells sweet potatoes to earn an income. She describes her biggest business challenges to be poor hygiene, sanitation, and lack of piped water. 

Lucy will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank. She hopes that, in the future, she will live a life that is comfortable and accommodating. This is Lucy's first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Jeff Anderson

texts.es:
Jeff es un estudiante de diseño gráfico y publicitario, deportivo emprendedor, y buen compañero de trabajo. 
Desde pequeño su hobby ha sido dibujar y crear cosas que vengan de la imaginación, ser muy atento a las cosas y muy servicial y colaborador. Entró a estudiar Arte Gráfico Y Publicitario porque quiere en un futuro ser un diseñador gráfico reconocido y exitoso por hacer bien sus trabajos y tener felices a los clientes con los que realice su trabajo.
Es un joven responsable dedicado con su trabajo ya que su fascinación siempre ha sido tener mucha creatividad, le encanta diseñar y crear cosas innovadoras y que llamen la atención de las personas de manera positiva y darles a entender que la creatividad y la imaginación no tienen límites y que se pude llegar a ser grande si solo se imagina y se hace un mundo diferente lleno de cosas gratificantes y tolerantes para los demás. 
La mejor forma de crear es ser libre e imaginar, esta frase le va muy bien ya que es un joven de mente abierta a las posibilidades, se siente libre y feliz para poder crear e imaginar, con ayuda de los que lo rodean logrará tener un buen desempeño en la parte estudiantil y en la parte social. 
El pide la aprobación de kiva ya que sería  gratificante poder costearse los transportes, trabajos  y alimentación mientras esté estudiando, por tal motivo agradecerá tener a kiva como apoyo, con este convenio podrá llegar a ser un buen diseñador gráfico y buen publicista y no quedarse atrás por no tener la oportunidad  de estudiar por no poder tener los recursos necesarios para pagar esta carrera.
texts.en:
Jeff is a graphic arts and publicity student, a sports entrepreneur and also a good work colleague.

Since he was a little boy his hobby has been drawing and creating things from his imagination, paying close attention to details and being very service-oriented and collaborative.  He began his Graphic Arts and Publicity studies because in the future he wants to be a well-known graphic designer who is successful in his work.  He wants to make his clients happy with his work.

Jeff is a responsible young man who is dedicated to his work as he has always been fascinated by having a lot of creativity.  He loves to design and create innovative things that attract people's attention in a positive way, opening their minds to the fact that creativity and imagination have no limits; and one can be something great if he imagines it.  This makes the world a different place full of gratifying things and tolerance for others.

The best way to create is to be free and imagine.  This is the phrase that best suits this young man who is open to possibilities.  He is free and happy to create and imagine.  With the help of those around him he will be successful in his studies and in society.

Jeff is requesting a loan from Kiva to pay for his transportation, fees and food while he is studying and he is grateful for Kiva's support.  With this help he will become a good graphic designer and publicist and not be left behind without opportunities because of not having enough resources to pay for his degree.

loans.use: To pay for his graphic arts education.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, a 33-year-old married mother of two children aged 13 and 12 years, has been running a retail shop in Kitengela for five years, currently earning a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya Shillings. 

Ann has requested her first loan with KADET LTD to purchase more stocks of sugar, flour, cooking oil and rice to sell. She will use her anticipated profits to build more rental houses on her plot of land. 

Her dreams are to expand her retail business, make more income and complete the construction of rental houses on her land.

loans.use: To buy more retail goods to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 53 years old and the father of four children, of whom all are currently studying in school. For the last fifteen years, he has earned a living by selling goods from his general store in Mpeketoni, Lamu where he earns a monthly profit of 14,000 KES. Joseph was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer and he is applying for his fourth loan of KES. 60,000 to purchase additional stock needed for his business. He will use the profit from the business to pay for school fees, purchase food for the family and expand the current business. Joseph hopes to own his own supermarket in future so as to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock  of goods for his business

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley, a 31-year-old tailor, is married to Joyce with whom he is blessed with one child. Stanley has been tailoring for the past three years, earning a monthly income of ksh.6000 which he uses to meet the needs of his family. 


Stanley is requesting his third loan with KADET after repaying his previous loans. He will use it to buy an over locking machine and more materials for sewing. With the expected profit he will buy a dairy cow. 


Stanley hopes and dreams that he will one day buy a piece of land and build a good and comfortable home for his family.

loans.use: To buy an over locking machine and more materials for sewing.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 33 years old, from Olkalou. He is married to Tabitha, with whom he has two children, aged seven years and eight months.

He is in the mixed-farming industry which he has practiced for the past seven years and, to enable him produce even more, he has applied for his second loan, in the amount of KES 30,000, from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) which he will use to buy fertilizer, planting seeds, and animal feed. The rest of the loan will be used to pay casual laborers on his farm.

Simon's monthly income right now is KES 22,000 and the anticipated profits from his expanded business will be used to start an income-generating project. He hopes that, in the future, he shall be able to buy more land and be able to educate his children to greater heights.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, planting seeds, and animal feed, and to pay casual laborers who assist with farm work.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a 37-year-old man. He has five children with ages ranging from 2 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a fairly good area and his primary customers are students. 

Solomon describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts to service his motorbike and  also for fuel. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good standard of living.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service his motorbike and  also fuel

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 63-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 10 to 30 years. She describes herself as enthusiastic. 

Grace operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and poultry. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a productive area. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of enough resources to expand her business. 

Grace will use the 20,000 KES loan to add to her stock of poultry and cows. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully

loans.use: to add to her stock of poultry and cows

loans.name: Las Decididas  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Las Decididas, este es un grupo formado por 10 mujeres y 2 hombres que se dedican a diversas actividades para mejorar su calidad de vida, se dedican al comercio, venta de comida entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Narcisa, tiene 48 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos son mayores de edad y el menor de 13 años que estudia en colegio y es el que aun vive con ella. El marido se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Doña Narcisa es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudarle a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar instaló en su casa una pequeña tienda con lo poco que tenia, es así como sale adelante ya que su esposo gana muy poco en sus faenas del campo,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 8pm y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados, tiene 12 años  su negocio y gracias a esto ha podido educarles a sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a ella y al grupo. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más. 

La foto pequeña es de un socio que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
Every 2 weeks, the communal bank "Las Decididas" meets in the city of Portoviejo.  It is a group made up of 10 women and 2 men that work in various fields so they can improve their quality of life.  They work as entrepreneurs, in food sales, and in other jobs.

Narcisa is a member of this group.  She is 48 years old and is in a free union in which she has 4 children.  Three of them are grown and her youngest (13 years old) is in high school and still lives with her.  Her husband works as a farmer.

Narcisa is a good mother and wife who helps her husband with the household bills with a small store that she set up in her house with what little she had.  This is how they get by, since her husband makes very little as a farmer.  She works every day from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm and sometimes even later.  Her husband and son both help her with her work when they aren't busy.  She has had her business for 12 years and because of it she has been able to put her children through school.
 
She will use this loan to further stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold cuts, and other basic goods.  She has been with her communal bank since it started and she likes it because of the help that it provides her and the other group members.

Her goals are that she can continue running her business and that it can grow every day.

The small photo is of a group member that couldn't be there when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold cuts, and other basic goods.

loans.name: Minas

texts.en:
Minas is from Zorak village in the Ararat region. He lives with his wife and four school-age children (three daughters – 11, 14 and 16 years old and a son – 8 years old). 

Minas is self-employed and is engaged in agriculture. He owns a piece of land, where he cultivates tomatoes, onions, and peppers. To cover his family’s daily needs, Minas breeds livestock (cow, hens, pigs, and piglets). 

Minas is currently seeking money for buying forage for 45 piglets. The needed money is USD 2500. 

Minas asks for the support of lenders, and hopes for a loan which will help him a lot in taking care of his family.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding piglets

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 70-year-old married woman. She has five children, with ages ranging from 23 to 42. She describes herself to be self-driven and trustworthy.

She operates a dairy farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business location is easily accessible, and conducive for business; her primary customers are common citizens. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of adequate funds. 

Mary will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed and a calf. Her business goal is to be a large-scale producer of dairy products within five years.

She hopes that in the future, she will diversify business and generate great profits. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy animal feed and a calf.

loans.name: Yessica Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí vive la señora Yessica, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 15, 10 y 2 años, los mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante informal.

Doña Yessica es una gran esposa que realiza el crédito para ella y para su marido, ella al igual que su marido se dedican a la venta de ropa, sabanas, forros de colchón, cortinas y varias cosas más, mientras ella vende por la localidad el marido se desplaza a otras ciudades a ofrecer sus productos, trabajan todos los días, el todo el día y ella solo en las mañanas porque aprovecha que sus hijos están en la escuela ya que en las tardes ella tiene que ayudarles en sus tareas escolares. Ella lleva 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad  mientras que su marido mucho mas, esta es la forma como siempre ellos luchan por sacarles adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, cortinas, sobrecamas y todo de lo que ellos venden. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
The communal bank Chimborazo meets every fifteen days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a very commercial zone, for its San Pedro and San Pablo traditional festivals, and for the happiness of its people.

Here lives Yessica. She is 30 years old and married. From this relationship she has three children who are 15, 10, and 2 years old. The oldest study in school. Her husband is an informal businessman.

Yessica is a great wife who is requesting this loan for herself and her husband. She and her husband work in the sale of clothing, bed sheets, mattress linings, curtains, and various other things. While she sells throughout the area, her husband goes to other cities to offer their products. They work every day, he all day and she only in the mornings. She takes advantage of her children being in school since in the afternoons she has to help them with their school work. She has been working in this activity for five years while her husband has been doing so for much more. This is the way in which they always struggle to help their children succeed.

They are going to apply this loan to the purchase of clothing, curtains, bedspreads, and everything they sell. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because of the ease to obtain loans.

Her dream is that her children study and that they be decent people.

loans.use: to buy clothing, curtains, bedspreads, etc.

loans.name: Tsotsoo's Group

texts.en:
The six members of this group are married women, who average 36 years of age and two children each; they all live in the same neighborhood in Teshie in the Republic of Ghana.  They all take a loan from ID-Ghana, and repay without trouble; they sell slippers, smoked fish, fried fish, bread, noodles, and plastic baskets. 

Tsotsoo is a kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fried fish seller, and she has been doing this work for 15 years. She is standing second from the left in the photo. With her loan amount of GHS 1,200, she intends to purchase one carton of fish and a bag of maize to prepare kenkey and fish, so that she can sell it to customers.

She plans on making a profit of GHS 700 from this loan. This profit will enable her to repay her loan, and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

Together, the group is taking a total amount of GHS 3,300 which would be used to purchase various items to boost their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase one carton of fish and a bag of maize to prepare kenkey and fish, so that she can sell it to customers.

loans.name: Patricia Amarilis

texts.es:
En el balneario San Clemente en Portoviejo  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son  visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, su gastronomía es muy variada y deliciosa.

En este lugar vive la señora Patricia, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 8 y 4 años, los dos mayores estudian  en escuela. Su esposo  se dedica a la pesca y en ocasiones  también realiza fletes en una moto taxi.

Doña Patricia es  una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de zapatos y  productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres  días a la semana  unas dos a tres  horas al día y en los momentos que está desocupada, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Los fines de semana ella con el esposo alquilan sillas y carpas a los turistas que llegan hasta este lugar. Tiene 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y toldos ya que las que tiene ya están dañados y necesita renovarlas. Lleva más de 4 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa ya que aún le falta mucho.
texts.en:
In the San Clemente resort in Portoviejo, the communal bank, 1 de Diciembre, meets every fifteen days. This place is known for its lovely beaches that are visited by many national and foreign tourists. Its gastronomy is greatly varied and delicious.

Patricia lives here. She is 31 years old and married. From this relationship she has three children who are 10, 8, and 4 years old. The two oldest study in school. Her husband makes a living fishing, and on occasion he also takes fares in a motorcycle taxi.

Patricia is a great housekeeper who, to obtain her own resources, works selling shoes and Yanabal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories). Her mode of sale is door to door, and she works three days a week, some two to three hours each day, as well as when she has a few moments free. She leaves her products on credit and collects each week. On weekends, she and her husband rent seats and awnings to the tourists who arrive there. They have been working in this activity for 12 years, and it’s going very well for her.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and sunshades since the ones she has are damaged and she needs to update them. She has been with the communal bank for more than four years and she likes it because of the help that the loans provide her.

Her dream is to finish constructing her house since there is still much left to do.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and sunshades.

loans.name: Miriam Katiana

texts.es:
En el balneario San Clemente en Portoviejo  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son  visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, su gastronomía es muy variada y deliciosa.


En este lugar vive la señora Mirian, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 18, 14, 8 y 6 años, los dos mayores estudian  en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es Ing. Eléctrico.

Doña Miriam es  una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja cinco  días a la semana una o dos horas al día y en los momentos que está desocupada ya que no tiene un horario fijo, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene ocho  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Lleva más de 5 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener un almacén de repuestos.
texts.en:
In the beach community of Portoviejo, the "1 de Diciembre" communal bank meets every 2 weeks.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many Ecuadorian and foreign tourists.  It's cuisine is very diverse and delicious.

Mirian lives in this place.  She is 38 years old, married, and has 4 children with her husband (ages 18, 14, 8, and 6 years old).  The oldest two are in high school and the younger ones are in secondary school.  Her husband is an electrical engineer.

Miriam is a great housewife who obtains her own income by selling Yanbal products (beauty products, perfume, and feminine accessories).  She sells door to door and works 1 or 2 hours a day, 5 days a week.  She works whenever she has spare time, since she doesn't have a set schedule.  She sells her products on credit and charges every week.  She has been doing this for 8 years and it has been going well for her.  Perfume is what she sells the most of.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and imitation jewelry.  She has been with this communal bank for 5 years and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her goal is to have an inventory storehouse.

loans.use: buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and imitation jewelry

loans.name: Acqaline

texts.en:
Acqaline is a 31-year-old married woman. She has one child who is 3 years old. She describes herself as self-driven and trustworthy. 

Acqaline operates a poultry farm, where she keeps layers that produce eggs for her to sell. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in an easily accessible location, conducive to business, and her primary customers are common citizens. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of adequate funds. 

Acqaline will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy chicken feed and more poultry. Her business goal is to be a large-scale provider of poultry products within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will diversify her business and generate great profits. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and more poultry

loans.name: Blanca Edita

texts.es:
En el balneario San Clemente en Portoviejo  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son  visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, su gastronomía es muy variada y deliciosa.


En este lugar vive la señora Blanca, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella y estudia en Universidad. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Blanca con su esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí venden  todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y veces hasta más tarde, además de estos productos también venden carne, pollo, pescado y útiles escolares. Llevan más de 15 años con su negocio con el cual han sacado adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal  más de  6 años y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the beach town of San Clemente in Portoviejo, the "1 de Diciembre" communal bank meets every 2 weeks.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many native and foreign tourists.  It's cuisine is diverse and delicious.

Blanca lives here and is 55 years old.  She is married and has 3 children with her husband.  They are all grown, but one of them lives with her and is a college student.  Her husband works in sales.

Blanca works with her husband in sales.  They have a grocery store in their house where they sell all kinds of goods, including rice, sugar, oils, detergents, and other things.  She works every day from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm and sometimes even later.  In addition to these goods, they also sell beef, chicken, fish, and school supplies.  They have been with their business for 15 years and it has allowed them to support their children.

She will use this loan to help stock their store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and other basic goods.  She has been in a communal bank for more than 6 years and she likes it because of the benefits that it gives her.

Her goals are to move forward with her business and for it to grow every day.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and other basic goods.

loans.name: Briceida Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el balneario San Clemente en Portoviejo  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son  visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, su gastronomía es muy variada y deliciosa.


En este lugar vive la señora Briseida, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen un hijo de 3 años. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.

Doña Briseida en sociedad con su mamá tiene un restaurante en el cual venden almuerzos y todo tipo de platos a la carta a preferencia del gusto de sus clientes, los mismos que prefieren los platos con mariscos.  Trabajan todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 16h00, llevan con su restaurante 10 años y les ha ido muy bien. 

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de  6 años  y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y responsable. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
In the beach community of Portoviejo, the "1 de Diciembre" communal bank meets every 2 weeks. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many Ecuadorian and foreign tourists. It's cuisine is very diverse and delicious.

Briseida lives here and is 28 years old.  She is married and has a 3-year-old son with her husband.  Her husband is a security guard.

Briseida has a restaurant with her mother where they sell lunches and all kinds of a la carte dishes according to the wishes of their customers.  Most of them favor dishes with seafood.  They work every day from 5:00 am to 4:00 pm.  They have had their restaurant for 10 years and it has been going very well for them.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other supplies for food preparation.  She has been in a communal bank for more than 6 years and she likes it because the group is very close and responsible.

Her dream is to give her son the best life she can.

loans.use: buy rice, meat, fish, and other goods.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez, a 46-year-old ambitious lady with six children, has successfully built her furniture-making business with the support of Kashf Foundation and KIVA. She previously took a loan to buy materials to increase her furniture sales and is now requesting a second loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase more nylon, ropes, and wooden frames. In this way she will be able to meet the demands of her customers consistently. 


Kaneez hopes to earn more income through her sales. She dreams of providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more nylon, ropes, and wooden frames.

loans.name: Daut

texts.en:
Daut is a 52 year-old male who is married; he has a son and daughter. Together, they all live in a Roma community in Kosovo. His wife stays at home to care for the house and take care of the family’s needs, while Daut goes to work to earn the family’s income. 

For more than ten years now, Daut has worked as a locksmith in a shop, and fixing doors and windows. This was a trade that he learned many years ago. Due to the length of time in the field and his hard work and dedication to those he serves in his community, he has been able to gain a lot of customers of all nationalities. 

Now he is requesting a loan so he can purchase tools for his shop. The loan will help him gain more customers and provide more services to them. 

His goal is to save money for his future. He appreciates this help!

loans.use: To purchase tools for his shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana con una edad de 34 años la cual tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el 2 grado por la falta de recursos económicos de parte de sus padres. Eso dio paso para que ellos le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra desde muy temprana edad especializándose en el cultivo de café ya que en su familia es una tradición. A sus 16 años decidió casarse con su actual pareja con la que procrearon 4 hijos la mayor de 15 años es hembra, el segundo un varón de 13 años, el tercero un varón de 9 años y el ultimo también varón de 5 años. Actualmente juntos en familia es un apoyo mutuo en las diferentes actividades que a diario se realizan en el campo trabajando fuerte en sus cultivos para sacar adelante su familia. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que tiene 20 años de dedicarse a desarrollar esta actividad ya que es la fuente de ingresos que su familia tiene para obtener lo básico. Las tierras donde cultivan son propias y están ubicadas a una distancia de 7 kilómetros de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie ya que no transita carro por la zona donde está el cultivo de café. 

Doña Juana sueña con poder crecer con sus bienes y como madre poder ver a sus hijos con familias y con hijos que sean personas de éxitos a futuro y que no se queden igual que ella que no pudo estudiar para que puedan enfrentar la vida de una manera diferente ya que con la ganancia ella planea seguirlos apoyando con sus estudios. Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: abono, foliares, fungicidas, etc. para poder dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Juana is 34 years old and was not able to stay in school past the second grade because her parents did not have enough money. For this reason, at a very young age, they taught her how to work the land. Her family has traditionally grown coffee, and she says this is the crop she worked in most. Juana married her husband when she was 16 years old, and together they have four children: a girl, age 15, and three boys, ages 13, 9 and 5.

Juana says that her family shares the different jobs to maintain their crops, and they work hard together everyday to get ahead. Juana says she has a lot of experience because she has grown coffee for 20 years. She says it is the source of income for her family’s basic needs. 

Juana says she owns the fields where she grows coffee, which are 7 kilometers from her home. The fields must be reached on foot because there are no roads for cars in the area. 

Juana says she dreams of increasing her assets and to be able to see her children with families and children of their own. She hopes that her children and grandchildren will be successful in the future and, unlike her, that they will continue with their studies and find a different way of life. Juana says she plans to continue using her income to help them pay for their schooling. 

Juana is requesting this loan from Kiva and the field partner to buy manure, fertilizer, fungicide and other agricultural supplies to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, fungicide and other agricultural supplies to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario vive en la zona de Mirafores de la ciudad de La Paz. Se dedica al contacto directo con los clientes en una empresa de insumos médicos. Rosario necesita el crédito para poder acceder a un curso de especialización en el área de insumos médicos y así poder ascender en el escalafón salarial de su empresa incrementando de esta manera sus ingresos.

El sueño de Rosario es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para dejar de vivir como arrendataria y mejorar el nivel de vida en su familia.
texts.en:
Rosario lives in the Mirafores area in the city of La Paz. She works directly with clients in a medical supplies company. Rosario needs the loan to be able to get into a specialization course in the area of medical supplies and thus be able to go up in the salary scale in her company and increase her income.

Rosario's dream is to be able to have enough money to get out of being a tenant and improve the standard of life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for a course on medical supplies.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 50-year-old married man, whose wife's name is Caroline, from Ndunyu Njeru. They have two children who are in school.

He has been in the farming business for five years and has now applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd. This loan will enable him to purchase timber and nails to complete the construction of his workshop business. He plans to pay school fees with the anticipated profit from his workshop business.

He hopes to expand his business and improve his family living standards.

loans.use: To purchase timber and nails.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 51 years old from Olkalou. She is a widow and supports a family of four children aged 36, 31, 27 and 23 years old.

She has been a farmer for the past 20 years; her monthly income right now is 20,000 KES.  Alice has applied for her second loan of 15,000 KES from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to buy farming supplies like fertilizer and planting seeds. She plans to use the anticipated income from her expanded farming activities to continue educating her child who is still in college.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be an established farmer in her village and to educate her daughter to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies like fertilizers and seeds for increased production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 500 avocados for resale.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is 55 years old, from Olkalou. He is married to Beth, who runs a hotel and they have three children, aged 16, 13, and 10 years old.

He is in the business of livestock sales which he has been running for the past eight years. 

He has applied for his fourth loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), in the amount of KES 100,000, to enable him to buy more sheep.

Abel's monthly income right now is KES 50,000 and the anticipated profit from the expanded business will be used for paying back the loan and for educating his children.

His hope and dream for the future is to upgrade his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more sheep which will be sold later, after they are fattened.
