As a main source of income for her family, Nurapa is raising livestock and growing farm produce, having launched 19 years ago by buying cattle for 10,000 KGS. Thanks to Nurapa’s hard work, her farm now includes one dairy cow, one , and 20 sheep. She also has a land plot of 2.09 ha [about 5.2 acres], where she grows beans every year. Nurapa’s monthly income is 10,000 KGS. With the goal of developing her business further, Nurapa has turned to the “Bai Tushum & Partners” microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS in order to use this loan for harvesting. Nurapa plans to use her resulting revenue in a further increase of cattle headcount. She plans to save up money to buy a new house.

loans.use: to pay for harvest help.

loans.name: Elne

texts.en:
Elne is 54 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc..

She has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending. Elne aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is from Stepanavan city of the Lori region. Her family consists of her husband and son. Tamara is a private entrepreneur and currently runs a grocery store in the city. The income from the store helps the family to cover their basic costs. The small grocery store that Tamara runs can hardly meet the needs of the family. This is the reason why she wants to expand the store a little bit and to sell a bigger quantity of products. 

Tamara took a loan from a local financial institution before and unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back because the family had hard times. However, thanks to Tamara's hard work recently, she has been able to run her business in a sustainable way, ensuring that she can cover the monthly payments. So, Tamara has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. The lenders will greatly support Tamara and her family by giving her an opportunity to collect the loan and to expand the business so that they can meet their daily costs.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 28 years old and married. She earns a living by growing lemon trees in the Philippines. She has been farming lemon trees for 2 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Perla is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia has more than 30 years of experience decorating cakes and more than five years owning her business, Angeli Cakes in El Paso, Texas.  She gained her experience by completing a mail order cake class in her earlier years and started her business with savings from her past and by working.  As a child, Patricia’s passion was always in the cake decorating business.

Now, a successful 53-year-old, Patricia offers a variety of custom baked-to-order cakes for the El Paso community.  Customers are able to pick and choose what kind of cake and frosting they want, design and color, and anything else a person can dream up.  Patricia also caters to her customers who are conscientious about their health.  Many of her cakes are gluten and sugar-free and sold to physical trainers, diabetics, and health gurus.

Accion Texas Inc., a nonprofit micro and small business lender, helped Patricia’s business, Angeli Cakes. After Patricia was referred to the microlender when visiting True Credit, a business specializing in credit restoration, she received a loan to purchase additional baking equipment, supplies, cake mix and decorations to meet the increased demand of orders while keeping her employee on payroll.

loans.use: to purchase additional baking equipment, supplies, cake mix and decorations

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 39 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from fishing, selling rice and a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Alona is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fobis

texts.en:
Fobis is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with eleven children living in Kasese,Uganda. 

For twenty-six years, she has been operating a retail shop, and with the proceeds she has been able to build a rental house and buy land for farming. Price fluctuation and the high cost of rent are her major challenges. Her dream is to own a wholesale shop.

Fobis intends to use the loan to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Nerlita

texts.en:
As a married mother of one kid, Nerlita works hard to support her family.

She operates a used clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and selling home products. Nerlita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional used clothing to sell to customers.

Nerlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business and continue to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en: Bendita is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is single and she is running a business in her house, selling rolling machines, such as those used for milled corn and milled rice. She is making a good income from selling rolling machines and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She opened her kiosk a year ago with working capital of $600.

loans.use: To buy rolling machines, such as those used for milled corn or milled rice.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 30 years old and she is married. She has five children. 

She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital to do so. 

She felt better when she applied for her first loan and she is now applying for her second loan, in the amount of USD 1,000. With the loan, Veronica will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as gasoline and petrol. 

She is happy with Tuba Rai Metin (TRM) which offers loans to poor people. She was very excited because TRM gives credit to those who cannot afford to run their businesses, but after getting credit from TRM, she is very proud.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and petrol.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben dreams of becoming a public accountant. To achieve his goal, Ruben has enrolled in Unicon. He expects to graduate in December, 2014 but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. 

Ruben shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With a loan, Ruben plans on purchasing his much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Ruben feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades.  With a degree in business he expects to earn $25 a day. With one older sibling, Ruben is unsure how he will be able to afford his tuition fees on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. To help afford his school and living expenses, Ruben currently works 40 hours a week and earns $17 a day.

loans.use: to pay for books

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her dormitory fees

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Isabel pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco-Perú. 
La socia Isabel sigue dedicándose a la ganadería y a su negocio de picanteria, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia vende comidas típicas a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo en su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz,aceite,carne entre otros.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the "Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Isabel works raising livestock and has a restaurant.  She is a responsible and earnest person.  She sells typical dishes to her clients.  

Isabel has had her business for a long time and it has been able to satisfy her both financially and personally.  She wishes to continue working to be able to continue supporting her family.  

Isable is requesting this loan to purchase supplies such as rice, oil and meat among others.  She is very grateful for KIVA allowing her to improve her family's quality of life and she is committed to honoring the agreed upon loan repayments.

loans.use: purchase supplies such as rice, oil and meat among others.

loans.name: Oyun-Erdene

texts.en:
Ms. Oyun-Erdene is a hard-working student who is studying at a public university. She has chosen her major as a chemical engineer because she was so interested in chemistry when she was in high school.  Her interest has enormous influence for her career. 

If she does not get a loan, she will have to drop out after one year.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,la socia hace platos de pollo al horno y sopas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hastra las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un restauran.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Hilda continues in her business selling food.  She prepares dishes of roasted chicken and soups. She works from 8am until 5pm, and she has been in business for 5 years already.  Her business is going very well, and her dream is to have a restaurant.

She is seeking this loan to purchase ingredients such as chicken, beef and vegetables.  She is very grateful for the loan and she is committed to repay the loan according to the agreed-upon schedule.

loans.use: purchase cooking ingredients such as chicken, beef and vegetables.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia Marleni pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco- Perú. 
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,leche,golosinas entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como leche y arroz.
La socia Marleni está agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a mantener y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Marleni belongs to the "Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She continues to work in her grocery store, which she has had for years and brings her much satisfaction both financially and personally.  She sells different types of products such as rice, milk, snacks, etc...  She is a responsible and earnest woman, which has allowed her to get her family ahead.  

She is seeking this loan to purchase merchandise such as milk and rice.  Marleni is very grateful for KIVA for allowing her to give her family a better quality of life and helping her to maintain and develop her business.

loans.use: purchase merchandise like milk and rice.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli has been engaged in her business for more than thirteen years and it is still successful. It helps her cover their daily basic needs. She is a member in Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative under CUMI membership and she has been a member in good standing for almost four years. 

Araceli is accessing a loan of twenty-five thousand pesos for additional stock of basic goods for her business. She is very grateful to have the financial assistance of Paglaum for her business in order for her to become a good entrepreneur. With the help of Paglaum she hopes that her business will do well always.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock for her "sari-sari" store.

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell frozen products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Jena is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of frozen products to sell for her buy-and-sell frozen products business.

Jena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of frozen products to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 35 years old and married with one child.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, canned goods, milk, eggs, noodles, etc.

Rosalie has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing and raising pigs.

Rosalie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, canned goods, milk, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is 28 years old and married with three children.

Ma. Cristina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like chips, canned goods, milk, soap, etc.

Ma. Cristina has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Ma. Cristina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like chips, canned goods, milk, soap, etc

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables for her vegetables business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Adoracion has been in this business for 15 years. Adoracion earns more income from raising pigs.

Adoracion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ruth works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Ruth is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 45 years old and married, with seven children. Six of them are in school.

Daisy earns a living by buying and selling veterinary supplies.  She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds and other veterinary supplies.

Daisy has been working with veterinary supplies for four years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds and other veterinary supplies

loans.name: Nobelinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nobelinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food-vending. Nobelinda is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional vegetables to sell through her buy-and-sell vegetable business.

Nobelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, noodles, soap, etc. for her general store business.

Annabelle has been in this business for 26 years. She earns more income from selling pre-paid mobile load.

Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to further fund the publishing process and reach more people in need.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Rowena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Rowena has been pig fattening for seven years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business selling salted eggs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional egg tray for her salted-eggs business.

Felicidad has been in this business for 10 years.   She also earns income from selling vegetables.

Felicidad has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional egg tray for her business

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Mary Rose works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  Mary Rose is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as snack foods, noodles, sugar, soap, shampoo, and other groceries for her general store.

Mary Rose has sustained her business activities through a past loan from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as snack foods, noodles, sugar, soap, shampoo, and other groceries

loans.name: Yuvotey's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Thmor Koul district, Yuvotey is 43 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. Yuvorey has been raising pigs, while her husband is a motor-taxi driver. Having been in this business for almost 13 years, she currently can earn about 38,000 KHR per day. 

Yuvotey has been with VisionFund for two cycles. The past loans have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy three piglets for raising. 

She highly hopes that this loan will enable her to fatten her pigs so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy three piglets for raising.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Nga is 53 years old and widowed. She is living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district. She has seven children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. Rice farming is the main source for her family’s income. Having been in this business for 20 years, she is able to earn about 38,000 KHR per day.
 
The current business earns her family a daily income of about 60,000 KHR and she is able to save 25,000 KHR each day. 

This is the third loan for Nga with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her current business. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. Nga will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Seat's Group

texts.en:
Seat is a 46-year-old mother of three children living in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassava on four hectares of farmland for almost twenty-six years. The current business earns her about 26,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first microloan for Seat with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Seat will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Pren

texts.en:
At age 60 years, Pren is the married father of three children, living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. 

Rice farming is the main source of family’s income.  He and his wife have been in this business for several years. 

Pren has been with VisionFund for five cycles, and he has completely repaid the past loans.  Those loans enabled him to better support his family and have some money. 

Now he is applying for a new loan. Pren wants to use it to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to grow his rice healthfully and sell it for a good price to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Shijir-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Shijir-Erdene lives with his two sisters, a brother and his parents in Govi-Sumber province. 

He has a passion for playing the national instrument, which is called the "morin-huur."   Therefore, he has chosen his major as an instrumentalist of the morin-huur. He is studying in a private university for a bachelor's degree.  

This loan is gving him the opportunity, as well as the inspiration, to study and graduate from his university successfully.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
Reynalda is married, with two children. She is 50 years old and lives in Patawag, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Reynalda operates her own furniture shop and she has had this business for two decades. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. 

Reynalda has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to pay for raw materials for her decor business.

She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). In the future, Reynalda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials for her decor business.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
LAIDOU est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiment et de restaurant à l’image de AMINATA qui est la personne  assise de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
AMINATA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à TIELE, excelle dans la vente de restaurant. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiments alimentaires, oignon, choux,  de la viande, du poisson et du riz.   Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Laidou is a group belonging to the association Benkadi from Tiele. It is made up of four women who met through ties of kinship and neighborhood. They have an average age of 35. Married and with five children each on average, they have varied businesses such as buying and selling condiments and selling cooked food, as in the case of Aminata, who is the woman seated on the right in the photo. They live in big traditional families in Tiele in the prefecture of Kati (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali.) 

They have been doing small-scale businesses for a good many years and are sought-after in their activities. Wishing to satisfy the growing needs of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. They are on their sixth solidarity loan. 

Aminata, who is the president of the group and well known in Tiele, is specialized in selling cooked food. She intends to use her loan to buy condiments, onions, cabbage, meat, fish and rice. She buys her ingredients in Bamako and right in the village from wholesalers and sells her food in Tiele, retail and for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of men and women. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 20,000 f CFA, a sum that will permit her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make cooked food

loans.name: Sandra Marleny

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer de 34 años de edad que desde muy temprana edad la cual desde muy pequeña aprendió el trabajo de la agricultura conocimientos que fueron traspasados por sus padres quienes han sido agricultores desde toda una vida produciendo café y guineo. Una parte de la tierra la ha adquirido compradas con gran esfuerzo y sacrificio y otra parte por herencia por parte de sus padres en la cual tiene sembrado café catimora y lempira. Ella es madre de 2 hijos y tiene un grado de educación primaria completa y en compañía de su esposo trabajan mancomunada mente y mientras llega la temporada de corta para vender el grano ella también se dedica a la venta de golosinas aprovechando a las personas que llegan a la recolecta de café en otras propiedades aledañas a la de ella.

Sus planes para el futuro es poder mejorar sus cultivos, hacer crecer más su plantación y seguir adquiriendo tierras para que eso sea posible ya que ella piensa en el bienestar de sus hijos y lo que hoy en día hace es fortalecer el patrimonio que un día los vera crecer a ellos y a las demás generaciones. Por eso hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual comprara fertilizantes, abono, formula cafetalera, fungicidas, etc. con lo que podrá dar asistencia y asegurar sus cultivos para la próxima temporada.
texts.en:
Sandra is 34-year-old woman who from an early age learned about agriculture from her parents.  They had been coffee and banana farmers their entire lives.  Sandra bought one piece of land through a great deal of work and sacrifice and the other, where she grows Catimor and Lempira coffee, she inherited from her parents.  She is the mother of two children and has a grade school education.  She and her husband work in concert.  As the short bean-selling season approaches, Sandra also sells sweets, benefiting from people who come to pick coffee on the properties around hers.

Sandra's plan for the future is to improve her crops and grow her plantation, which she'll make possible by continuing to acquire land.  She believes in the well being of her children and strengthening their inheritance now so that one day she'll see them and further generations grow.  That's why she's seeking a loan to buy fertilizers, coffee-growing formula, fungicides, etc., which she'll use to aid her crops for the next season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Babina

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Babina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  Babina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as chips, milk, canned goods, soy sauce, etc., for her general store.

Babina has sustained her business activities through a loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, such as chips, milk, canned goods, soy sauce, etc

loans.name: Flordecita

texts.en:
Flordecita earns a living by selling ready-to-wear products. She is 59 years old and single, and she lives in Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. 

She is now well known for the nice quality of the products she offers. She has already purchased some new finished products and been able to save from doing that. Her business is self-sustaining and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 6,000 per month.  

Flordecita is seeking a PHP 10,000 loan. She would like to use the money to purchase special items.

This is a microfinance loan, and it would be repaid in few months. In her two previous loans, she has never had a delinquency. 

Flordecita is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to her effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy products to sell, such as dry goods and ready-to-wear

location.town: Sindangan - Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Janara

texts.ru: Жанаре 31 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Жанары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жанара занимается животноводством, стартовав 4 года назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жанары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жанара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Жанара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Janara is 31 years old, married and together with her husband, is raising two children.  Janara has only high school education.  Raising of the livestock provides the main source of income to her family.  Janara started this business four years ago by purchasing cattle for 10,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, Janara now has 10 sheep.  Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS.  

In order to expand her enterprise, Janara applied for a loan of 60,000 KGS to the microfinance bank of Bai Tushum and Partners.  She wishes to use this loan to purchase additional sheep, which she will raise and then sell, at a premium, at the market.  Janara is planning re-invest the profits back into her business by purchasing additional livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI II est un groupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans. Elles sont mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de céréales et de condiments à l’image de KOSSIRA qui est la première personne assise de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. 
Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la  préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
KOSSIRA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à TIELE, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiment alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon, choux et cube maggi.).  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO auprès des grossistes  et revend à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en: The Benkadi II Group is composed of 4 women who know one another through ties of parentage and community. They average 50 years of age. They are married with an average of three children each. They run different businesses such as the buying and selling of grains and vegetables for making sauces. In the image, Kossira is the first seated person from the right to the left of the photo. They live in large traditional families in Tiele in the prefecture of Baguineda (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). They have been in small business for several years and are very sought after in their businesses. In the interest of satistfying the growing needs of their clientele, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. They are on their third group loan. Kossira, who is the president of the group and very well known in Tiele, excels in the sale of vegetables for sauces. She expects to use her loan to purchase different types of vegetables for making sauces (peppers, tomatoes, onions, cabbage and Maggi bouillon cubes). She stocks up in Bamako from the wholesalers and resells in Tiele, at retail, for cash and for credit to a clientele made up of men and women. She hopes for a monthly profit of 20,000 f CFA, a sum which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for making sauces.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Rosalia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosalia is borrowing PHP 21,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks of rice for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Rosalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice.

loans.name: Nimol

texts.en:
Nimol (pictured with her loom) lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has children - one attends school, and another one is still young. Her husband is a mason.

Nimol has asked for a Kiva loan. She hopes to continue her silk-weaving business; hence she applied for another loan to purchase raw silk.

loans.use: To buy raw silk for weaving

loans.name: Grethel Cristhina

texts.es: Doña Grethel desde muy Joven inicio su propio negocio ya que ella siempre le ha gustado la independencia, habita en el municipio La Concepcion en el barrio San Juan junto a su compañero de Vida y su hijo, con este credito compra Mercaderia como Ropa para Damas que es su mayor demanda, pero tambien aprovecha las festividades Patria de este mes para comprar Unifornes y Calzado para obtener mayor ganacias y asi sus condicones de vidad podran mejorar, Agradecida la señora Grethel por el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le estan brindado.
texts.en:
Grethel started her own business when she was very young.  She did this because she has always liked being independent.  She lives with her life partner and her child in the San Juan neighborhood in the Concepción municipality.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise like women’s clothes, which is her greatest demand.  However, she will also take advantage of the national holidays this month in order to buy uniforms and shoes.  She will do this in order to get greater income.  This way she will be able to improve her living conditions.

Grethel is grateful for the support that AFODENIC and Kiva are providing.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Melibeth

texts.en:
Melibeth is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing/fish-vending business.

Melibeth has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income by raising pigs.

Melibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay coffee cutters.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy (in the photo) is 43 years old and lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. She has four children. Two have full-time employment and the other two attend school.   

Savy is a garment worker, while her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for a loan to purchase construction materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.name: Wualdimiro

texts.es: Wualdimiro de 42 años de edad habita en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y su hija de 17 años. Para lograr ingresos y sostener a su familia, cuenta  con un negocio mediante el cual se dedica venta de pollo y también genera otros ingresos en la venta mercancía variada. Su negocio inició cuando se le presento la oportunidad de comprar un congelador, con el que inició vendiendo pollo congelado en la comunidad de su barrio. Con esta primera experiencia le fue muy bien, pues tuvo mucha acogida entre sus vecinos y poco a poco hizo crecer su clientela, la que aprovecha, para venderle mercancía variada, ajustada a sus necesidades como ropa y calzado. Wualdimiro compra y vende diariamente el pollo y en el caso de la mercancía lo hace cada 15 días, comprando  en otras ciudades a las que viaja. Su meta mas adelante es distribuir en tiendas y lograr pagarle los estudios universitarios a su hija. Su mayor desafío es afrontar la competencia y sus estrategias de mercadeo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  pollo, ropa y calzado que tiene encargado. Con esta inversión pretende capitalizar el negocio, para responder a pedidos de su clientela y ser cada día mas efectivo en la entrega.
texts.en:
Wualdimiro, 42 years old, lives in the municipality of Soledad with his wife and 17-year old daughter.  To earn an income and support his family, he has a business through which he makes a living selling chicken and other various merchandise.

His business started when he got the opportunity to buy a freezer.  With this, he started selling frozen chicken in his neighborhood community.  This first experience went very well for him, he was well received among his neighbors, and little by little he grew his clientele.  He takes advantage of this to sell them various merchandise, adapted to their needs, such as clothing and footwear.

Wualdimiro buys and sells chicken daily, and in the case of the merchandise, he does it every 2 weeks, buying in other cities where he travels.  His future goal is to distribute to stores and to be able to pay for daughter's university studies.  His greatest challenge is to face the competition and their marketing strategies.  

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which he will buy chicken, clothing and footwear for which he has orders.  With this investment, he hopes to capitalize the business, in order to respond to orders from his customers and to be more and more effective with the deliveries.

loans.use: to buy chicken, clothing and footwear for which he has orders.

loans.name: Gerarda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba, y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Gerarda alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de maíz, ella compra maíz al por mayor y lo vende en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gerarda belongs to the "SAYHUA 3" community bank. This bank is located in the district of Urubamba, part of the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

Gerarda alternates her daily activities with a business selling corn. She buys corn in bulk and sells in the market in Urubamba from 6 am to 7 pm. By means of this business she supports her children. She wants to expand and improve her business selling corn. She is seeking the loan in order to buy corn in bulk.

She is pleased to receive the loan and promises to comply with the payment of her instalments.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhjargal, 54 years old, lives with her only daughter in a slum district of Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a janitor at an organization that takes care of elder people for a long time. 

Two years ago, she purchased building materials and improved her house.  Now she is requesting a loan of MNT 4,000,000 to purchase vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, and an iron door. 

By installing those items, she will make her house a comfortable and warm place where she and her daughter will burn less coal for heating. Less coal means fewer pollutants, and this action contributes to efforts against air pollution. 
 
Mrs. Enkhjargal is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, and an iron door

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de coca, producto que lo adquiere en ADEPCOCA y lo distribuye en poblaciones lejanas del altiplano boliviano, vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Villa el Carmen de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito lo  requiere para el aumento de capital, y de esta manera poder llegar a más poblaciones incrementando de esta manera sus ingresos. La venta de coca para hacer mates es un negocio legitimo y rentable en Bolivia 

El sueño de Epifania es poder tener casa propia, generar mayores ingresos elevando asi el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Epifania is a merchant who sells coca leaves.  She acquires this product from ADEPCOCA and distributes it in the remote villages of the Bolivian high plains.  Epifania lives at her parents’ house in the District of Villa del Carmen in the city of La Paz.

The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital so that she can distribute to more villages.  Increasing her inventory in this manner will result in more income.  Selling coca leaves for making herbal teas is a legitimate and profitable business in Bolivia.  

Epifania dreams of having her own home, generating more income, and elevating her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy coca leaves to sell.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul es soltero y tiene un hijo, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando tres habitaciones,la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Santiago II en la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente trabaja en una empresa privada por mas de ocho horas al día pero con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los pagos de alimentación, estudios y transporte ya que el vive en la ciudad de El Alto y su trabajo es en la zona Sur y gasta mas en pasajes aparte de cubrir los pagos de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de estudios superiores ya que con eso mejorara sus ingresos económicos para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Raul es tener  su propia empresa de arquitectura para mejorar su calidad de vida y posteriormente adquirir una casa en anticretico para tener mas comodidad y seguridad.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y también con KIVA.
texts.en:
Raul is single and has a son.  He lives in his parents' house, occupying three rooms.  The house is situated in the Santiago II zone of the city of El Alto.  

He currently works at a private company for more than eight hours a day, but with the income that he has, he must cover the costs of food, studies, and transportation, since he lives in the city of El Alto and his work is in the Southern zone.  Thus he spends more on the trip in addition to covering the costs of basic services.

He needs the loan to pay for higher studies, since with this, he will improve his earnings to support his family.  Raul's dream is to have his own architecture business, in order to improve his quality of life and later get a fixed-rent house to have greater comfort and security.

This is the first time he is working with IMPRO and with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for higher studies in architecture.

loans.name: Amani Group

texts.fr:
Jérôme fait partie du groupe  Amani  et  habite à Gitega. Il a 53 ans et est marié. Sa famille est composée de 10 enfants âgés de 11 à 33 ans.

Il  fait le commerce  de boutique ( riz, haricot,   l’huile de palme,...)  depuis  5 ans. 

Il est à son dixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter  son capital
 et acheter une grande d’articles (riz, haricot, huile de palme…)  à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Jérôme is part of the Amani group and lives in Gitega. He is 53 years of age, married, and has 10 children between the ages of 11 and 33. For the past five years he has worked selling grocery items (rice, beans, palm oil).

Jérôme is on his 10th loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan he obtains, he plans to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of items (rice, beans, palm oil) which he will resell to earn more.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of items (rice, beans, palm oil) which he will resell to earn more.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
Ursula is married, with five children. She is 61 years old and lives in Patawag, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Ursula raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase sacks of feed for her pigs.

Ursula has become a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to have more pigs to raise.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Charry

texts.en:
Charry is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Charry has been in this business for three years.  She also earns income from selling vegetables.

Charry has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Ziregul

texts.ru: Зирегул 25 лет, разведена, одна воспитывает двоих детей (1 дочь, 1 сын). В 2002 году, начала бизнес в торговле детскими вещами, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 6,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Зирегул имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, Зирегул смогла увеличить товарооборот и развить свой бизнес. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Зирегул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Зирегул планирует вложить в товарооборот и накопить деньги на обучение своих детей.
texts.en: Ziregul is 25 years old and she is divorced with two children (one daughter, one son).  In 2002 she launched a business selling children's goods with a starting capital of 6,000 som (KGS).  Since she has managed to increase her business and attract regular clients, Ziregul has an average monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work in her business, Ziregul has been able to increase her turnover and develop her business.  With the goal of increasing her business further, Ziregul has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to increase her turnover.  She plans to use the income from the loan to increase her turnover and to save up money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy wholesale children's clothing for retail sale.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is married, with four children.  She is 40 years old and lives in Patawag, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Marieta is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years.  She has requested a loan to buy sacks of feed for her pigs.

Marieta has become a new member of PMPC. In the future, Marieta hopes to have more pigs to grow.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Munkhjargal

texts.en: Munkhjargal, 29 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in an old house on fenced land in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia.  She is a railroad engineer at a train station and she has been working there for seven years.  Her husband works at a private company. Her daughter goes to kindergarten.  She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as shingles, bricks, fiberglass and foam.  Using those materials, she and her husband want to repair and insulate their house.  After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they won't burn as much coal for heating, which has positive impact on the environment as less pollutants are released into the atmosphere.  The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 58 years old and married, with one child.

Fely works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell, like sugar, rice, and canned goods.

Fely has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from direct-selling and farming sugarcane.

Fely aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like sugar, rice, and canned goods.

loans.name: Girly

texts.en: Girly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soap, shampoo, detergent, etc. to sell in her general store business.  Girly has been in this business for 6 years.  She earns more income from food vending and farming rice.  Girly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like soap, shampoo, detergent, etc. to sell

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
DJEKAFO est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe 5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans. Mariées d’au moins quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiment et de restaurant à l’image de FANTA qui est la première personne assise de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la sous préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
FANTA, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des céréales (mil et riz) et des condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon, choux, concentrés de tomates.) pour des fins de restauration.  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
The DJEKAFO group is part of the BENKADI association of TIELE. It consists of five married women who know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. They average 45 years of age and four children each. Their activities include buying and selling condiments and restaurant services, which is the activity conducted by FANTA, sitting on the right in the photo. These women live in large traditional families in TIELE, sub-prefecture of BAGUINEDA (region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali). They have been engaged in small trade for several years and they are in high demand. 

To meet the growing needs of their clientele, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance program. This is their 3rd group loan. FANTA plans to use her credit to buy cereals (millet and rice) and various condiments (peppers, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, condensed tomato products) for her restaurant activity. She buys her merchandise from BAMAKO wholesalers and sells her food in TIELE, at retail, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 30,000FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and to reinvest a portion in her activity.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant services.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: As a married parent of five children, Gina works hard to support her family.  She buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and corn.  Gina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.  Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more stock like soft drinks, rice, sugar, eggs, etc. to sell in her general store.  Gloria has been in this business for 7 years.  She earns more income from food vending.  Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like soft drinks, rice, sugar, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is 59 years old and married with four children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods like rice, sugar, shampoo, soap, soft drinks, etc. to sell.  Imelda has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns income from farming sugarcane.  Imelda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods like rice, sugar, shampoo, soap, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Remia

texts.en: Remia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pottery business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her pottery business.  Remia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan in order to build her business.  NWTF is re-listing Remia's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
As the married mother of four children, Leonida works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.  She also earns income from food vending. 

Leonida is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Leonida has sustained her business activities through no fewer than 21 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of  saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 48 years old and married, with five children, two of whom are in school. Carmen works very hard to provide for them.

Carmen runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell.

Carmen has been in this business for two years and she sells a variety of items, such as sardines, snack foods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Carmen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn is 41 years old. She makes and sells typical Cambodian cakes at home. Her husband is a security guard. She lives across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and she has two children. One is a garment worker and the other attends school. 

Sophorn has a motorbike to use in the family, but the motorbike is old and she wants to replace it with a new one. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan. 

Photo: The photo of Sophorn was taken in front of her neighbor’s house, in which there is a loom.

loans.use: To replace the old motorbike with a new one to use in the family.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de jugos, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende diferentes tipos de jugos como platano, papaya entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia. 
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar frutas y azúcar.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member continues working in her business of selling juices. She has had this business for years, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She sells different types of juices, such as banana and papaya, among others. She want to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.

She is applying for the loan to buy fruits and sugar.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy fruits and sugar to make juice.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly (in the photo), age 43, stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s salary from the military police. She lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh and has four children. Three are singers and musicians and the other attends school.   

Ly is asking for a loan to put windows with mirrors in her house.

loans.use: To put windows with mirrors in her house.

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en: Bolor-erdene, 28 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in a traditional Mongolian four-walled ger (portable felt dwelling) on fenced land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He has been rendering taxi service to local people for seven years and during that time he has accumulated a vast amount experience in shortening routes and driving fast.  His wife has a disability due to a factory accident and gets a disability pension.  Their daughter is three years old and stays at home.  He is requesting a loan of 2,600,000 MNT to purchase a traditional Mongolian five-walled ger. The five-walled ger is more comfortable and easier to keep warm than a four-walled ger.  Last year, the family were chilled down to their cores as their old ger wasn't enough to protect them from frosts and snow storms.  Once they move into their new five-walled ger, they will begin to burn less coal for heating, which is good for environment as less pollutants will be released into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to buy a traditional Mongolian five-walled ger (portable felt dwelling)

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en: Savorn, age 31, lives in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  She has four children: two sons and two daughters.  Two of them attend school and the other two are still young.  Savorn is a construction worker, while her husband is a mason.  She is asking for a loan to add to her own money to purchase a motorbike to drive to work.  She commutes to work by bicycle now.

loans.use: to add to her own money to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Josephine works hard to support her family.  She has a welding shop in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Josephine is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her welding business.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses.  Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her welding shop

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marjorie works hard to support her family.

She has a candy-making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Marjorie is borrowing PHP 29,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional ingredients for her candy-making business.

Marjorie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her candy-making business.

loans.name: Carla

texts.en:
Carla is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Carla is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Carla has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Roet's Group

texts.en:
Roet, age 58, is living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district. She has eight children. 

She is widowed and she makes a living through farming rice on two hectares of farmland. The current business earns her about KHR 50,000 per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is the micro-loan for Roet’s group and she has been with VisionFund Cambodia for two cycles. She completely paid back the past loans. She has successfully used the past loans to help her relieve her financial burden and improve her livelihood. 

Now requesting a loan, Roet, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business, to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 59 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  Aida is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Aida has been raising pigs for twelve years now, and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Aida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de bisuteria,la socia realiza collares,aretes y pulseras,la socia lo vende a sus diferentes amigos o familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los aretes,collares y pulseras.La socia solicita le credito para comprar materiales como hilos y piedras para que elabore los aretes,collares y pulseras.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to engage in her costume jewelry business.  She makes necklaces, earrings, and bracelets and sells them to different friends and family members.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell these items.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials, such as thread and stones, for making earrings, necklaces, and bracelets.  

The borrower is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy thread and stones for making costume jewelry.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo, es casado y tiene seis hijos, vive en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones pequeñas, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa la Merced en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por mas de diez horas al día ya que es mecánico y a veces sale durante la noche a realizar auxilios mecánicos,con los pocos ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de su taller mecánico ya que desea tener mas espacio para trabajar  y de esta forma mejorara sus ingresos por que podrá atender mas vehículos que necesiten algún arreglo o mantenimiento.
El sueño de Teofilo es ampliar su taller con un tinglado para no trabajar al aire libre bajo el sol o la lluvia ya que eso retarda su trabajo.
Es la sexta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Teofilo is married and has six children.  He lives in his own home, which consists of two small rooms.  The house is located in the District of Villa La Merced in the city of La Paz.

At the moment, he works more than 10 hours a day as a mechanic.  Sometimes he leaves during the night to work on minor mechanical jobs.  With what little income he earns, he is able to pay for expenses such as food and the cost of basic services for his family.  

The loan he is requesting will be used for repairs to his auto repair shop.  He wants to have more work space so that he can improve his earnings and service more vehicles that are in need of repairs or maintenance.  

Teofilo dreams of expanding his shop by adding a shed so that he does not have to work in the open air where the sun or rain could slow down his work.  This is the sixth time he has requested a loan from IMPRO, but the third time from Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for additional repairs to his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla is 46 years old and lives in a village about 25 kilometers from the Phnom Penh City. She has three children, two sons and one daughter. All of her children are garment workers.
    
Phalla and her husband are rice farmers. She is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her sons to drive to work.
Photo: Phalla is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her sons to drive to work.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.es:
La socio Celsa se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de pollos y pescados,la socia vende en el mercado,la socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales,la socia cria cuyes,pollos y chanchos y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos y pescados.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pollos y pescados.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Celsa continues to engage in her business of selling chickens and fish.  She sells at the market, but she also continues her business of raising animals.  Celsa raises guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs before selling them at different fairs.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell chickens and fish.  

Celsa is requesting a loan in order to buy chickens and fish.  She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens and fish.

loans.name: Bethy Jamileth

texts.es:
Bethy tiene 24 años de edad es madre de cuatro hijos, ama de casa y agricultora, acompañada con un grado de educación primaria completa. Como madre de familia, mujer luchadora y trabajadora vela por el bienestar de su familia y decidió a muy temprana edad aprender a trabajar la tierra siguiendo los pasos de sus padres los cuales son agricultores de toda una vida y de generación en generación. Ella lo realiza hace más de 10 años ya que fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad. Su conyugue es agricultor también y en su compañía son los únicos que se involucran en el cultivo de café. La tierra que trabajan es propia la cual fue comprada gracias al esfuerzo y trabajo puesto. Su cliente principal es IHCAFE quien le compra la producción en su totalidad por lo que ella agradece tener un comprador fuerte como lo es esta prestigiada empresa. 

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono,  foliares, formula cafetalera entre otros para poder asistir sus cultivos de café por lo que la corta se aproxima y quiere asegurarla.

Actualmente su meta es proteger sus cultivos asistirlos de manera especial y fortalecerlos de manera que al final de la cosecha ella pueda sacar las ganancias esperadas y poder obtener ingresos para cumplir con su compromiso. Como madre apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y en lo que ella vea necesario y posible para su futuro como también fortalecer el patrimonio que hoy en día levanta con su pareja.
texts.en:
Bethy is 24 years old and is the mother of four children. She is a homemaker and farmer and completed her primary school studies. As the mother of a family, a struggling and hardworking woman, she looks after the welfare of her family and she decided at an early age to learn to work the land following in the footsteps of her parents, farmers all of their lives from generation to generation. She has been doing this work for more than ten years when her parents taught her to farm at an early age. Her husband is a farmer too and in his company they only engage in the cultivation of coffee. The land that they work is their own which was bought thanks to their efforts and the work they put in. The main customer is IHCAFE [Institute of Honduran Coffee] who buys their entire production and she is grateful to have a strong buyer such as this prestigious company.

She is asking for a loan from the communal bank Comixmul in order to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, foliar, coffee producing formula and more in order to care for her coffee crops as the harvest is approaching and she wants to be look after it. 

Currently her goal is to protect her crops, assisting them and strengthening them so that when harvested she can obtain income in order to complete her commitment. As a mother she supports her children in their studies and she does what she beholds necessary and what she can do for their future as well as building an inheritance that today she is raising with her husband.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He is using his loan in his business and his business is continuously growing. From his loan, he was able to assist his children's education as well. There are some challenges that he is facing in his business but he is always finding ways to overcome them. He is a hardworking father whose desire is to help not just his family but even others.

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan which he will use to buy more fish to sell. More items to sell will result in better profits. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Nestor dreams to have more stalls for his business and hopes that his family will always be in good health. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ednalyn

texts.en:
Ednalyn is 47-years-old andwidowed with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ednalyn has a making and selling salt business in the Philippines. Ednalyn has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her salt making.

Ednalyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Ednalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her salt making.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 62-years-old, married and has one child.

Emma is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Emma has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Emma has been farming rice for eleven years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenechimeg, 36-years-old, lives with her mother and two children in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on fenced land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling trousers to local people by renting a stall at an outdoor market since 2005. 

Her daughters go to high school. Her mother has retired and gets a state pension. 

She buys trousers in large quantities from the border with China at a lower price and later sells them at higher price. Due to a lack of cash, her business circulating capital diminished so she is requesting a loan of 2000000 MNT in order to buy a large quantity of trouser. By doing so, she will be able to continue to sell trousers without worrying about inventory shortage. This business is the only income generator on which her family relies on.

loans.use: to buy trousers in large quantities.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She is using her loans in her business to provide additional capital and her business is continuously growing. Her income from business is also a big help to her family's everyday expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Merla hopes to become successful not just in business but also in life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. At these meetings she also draws strength and inspiration from studying the word of God.
