He usually gets an average net income of PHP 20,000 each harvest season, twice a year. He would like to improve the nutrition of his crops and that is why he is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pay for labor costs spent on farming. This will help improve his production. 

Mario has promised to pay back the loan after harvest and that additional revenue that will be generated will be saved to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pay for labor costs spent on farming.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 25 years old and married with two children. Lourdes works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, milk, soap, sugar, etc. Lourdes has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, milk, soap, sugar, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Ngi's Group

texts.en: Ngi is a mother of six children in her mid-50s. She is a resident of Battambang Province’s Sangke District. She raises chickens and sells desserts to earn the daily costs of living and sustain her family. Her husband helps support her via working as a schoolteacher. She has been involved in her current business for two years, and it has returned to her about 34,000 riels per day. This is the first microloan for Ngi with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In her group of two, she is the leader. Ngi will spend her loan portion to buy more chickens to raise and more ingredients for making sweets to sell. She hopes to double her income to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 54 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, sugar, coffee, milk, etc.. Lita has been in this business for six years.

In the future Lita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, sugar, coffee, milk, etc.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en: Erwin is a 29 year old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has 3 young children. He does carpentry work. He provides all types of wood carpentry services. He has been in the carpentry business for almost 4 years. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase carpentry tools such as a saw and sharpening steel. In the future Erwin would like to expand his carpentry services to provide his children with good food and quality education.

loans.use: to purchase carpentry tools such as a saw and sharpening steel.

loans.name: Khoeurt's Group

texts.en:
Khoeurt is 46 years old and a villager from Sangke district of Battambang province. She has three children. For the sake of her family, she raises chickens at home while her husband works at a construction site. Engaged in her current business for 10 years, she is able to earn up to 15,800 KHR per day. 

Khoeurt is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); that's the same cycle as her co-borrower in the group of two. This cycle, she and her fellow group member are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. She will spend her loan portion to buy more chickens for raising and to buy necessary materials to support her husband's occupation. She hopes to gain a good income from her chickens.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for raising

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en: Residing in Sangke district of Battambang province, Rom is 54 years old and has six children. Her main source of income is from rice farming. This is the business that she has had for ages. Rom has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now, she is leading a group of two to get a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. She will spend her loan portion to  buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for plowing.  She hopes that she can gain a good yield from her crop and make a good income to support her family.

loans.use: To  buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Yeang's Group

texts.en: Yeang is 60 years old and a local farmer from Battambang province’s Sangke district. She is a mother of five children. She and her husband grow rice as their main source of income. She has been involved in her current business for 20 years, earning about 10,000 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Yeang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).   She is seeking 200,000 KHR whereas her joint borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. She will spend her loan portion to buy two sacks of fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can make a good income from her crop and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Faroukou

texts.fr: Revendeur de viande de bœuf et chèvre au marché, Faroukou pour satisfaire ses clients sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES. Il est aidé par 01 personne et désire à l'avenir devenir un grossiste et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Âgée de 26ans, il est marié et n'a pas d'enfants en charge pour l'instant.
texts.en: A seller of beef and goat meat at the market, Faroukou is requesting a first loan from WAGES so that he can satisfy his customers' needs. He is helped by one person and in future he would like to become a wholesaler and be able to support his family. At 26 years old, he is married but has no children for the moment.

loans.use: to buy beef and goat meat to sell

loans.name: Soum

texts.en:
Soum is 31 years old and the mother of three dependent children.  Two of the children are in school and one is younger. She overcomes her family's financial burden through rice and cassava farming. The current business earns her about 37,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first microloan for Soum with VisionFund. She is requesting a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy rice seed, fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella runs a boutique business in Makueni town where she sells clothes, shoes, and handbags, among other boutique items. She is 24 years old and single. She has been in this business for the past six months.

This being her first loan term with KADET LTD, she plans to use the loan to buy an additional stock of clothes and shoes to sell. This will enable her to satisfy the needs of her customers, as well as generate more income.

In the future, Angella hopes to grow her boutique business by stocking it and selling more varieties of wholesale clothes and shoes, and becoming financially stable.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is 56 years old and married with one kid.

Sherly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sherly has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Sherly aspires to save money to expand her business and improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 33 years old and a single mother of three children. She runs a green grocery shop and has been in the business for three years making a monthly income of 7,000 Kenya Shillings. 

She will use the loan to buy more vegetables to sell in her business. She will also buy potatoes, carrots, tomatoes and fruits.

This is her first loan with KADET Ltd. and she anticipates to make more profits with which she will buy a plot of land. 

Grace's future hopes and dreams are to be a great supplier of horticultural products and also to start another business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family; she has a tricicad transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Mary Ann requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her tricicad.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her tricicad

loans.name: Andrea Del Pilar

texts.es:
Andrea es una mujer que quiere estudiar servicios farmacéuticos para ampliar sus conocimientos y de esta manera ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia. Por este motivo quiere depositar su confianza en una excelente institución  y a su vez  motivar a las personas a cambiar su estilo de vida a través de su fácil acceso a la educación.
Ingresó  en el programa de auxiliar en servicios farmacéuticos ya que su principal objetivo en el momento de desempeñarse laboralmente es brindar los más altos estándares de calidad en sus servicios y  formarse como una persona con gran liderazgo, critica y ética y de esta manera poder organizarse y  poder crear su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Andrea is a woman who wants to study pharmaceutical services to expand her knowledge, and in this way, offer her family a better future.  For this reason, she wants to place her trust in an excellent institution and at the same time motivate people to change their lifestyle through easy access to education.

She joined the pharmacy assistant program, since her primary objective in her professional development is to bring the highest standards for quality in her services and to get trained as a person with great leadership, acclaim and ethics.  In this way, she would like to get organized and create her own business.

loans.use: to pay for her education at CampoAlto.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a very hardworking woman who lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Sidi operates a cafe business where she makes various food like beans, rice, tea, and chapatti (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbours. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase food items, tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. 

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food items, tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Sandra Marcela

texts.es: Todo  comenzó hace 24 años, cuando en Jamundí Valle  Sandra quiso emprender su propio camino sola sin ayuda de sus padres, de esta manera viaja a otro lugar donde allí conoce a un joven formaron una relación y de esa relación nació un hermoso bebe, pero la felicidad duro poco  porque al poco  tiempo aquello que ella creía hermoso y bello termino, y fue así que entonces se decidió  volver con su familia, pero al encontrarse allí radicada se le presento un problema por ser zona de alta violencia fue amenazada por un grupo armado entonces se encontró con una gran encrucijada y de esta    manera se decide a viajar  a una ciudad fría y donde prácticamente no conocía a nadie, pero llena de oportunidades así que  decide iniciar desde cero y lo hace comenzando por terminar sus estudios y comienza a estudiar enfermería lo que más le gusta en una institución donde le brinda oportunidad de poder hacer su gran sueño realidad, aunque a veces le falte el presupuesto necesario para poder continuar con este, pero ella es fuerte e insiste en hacer lo que más le gusta.
texts.en:
Everthing began in Jamundí Vallen at the age of 24 when Sandra started out on her own without the help of her parents.  She traveled to another place and started a relationship with a young man.  As a result, a beautiful baby was born.  However, her happiness was short-lived because everything she believed to be beautiful and lovely suddenly ended.  

At that point, she decided to return to her family but moving back home would be problematic since they lived in an area with a high level of violence.  On the way back, she ran into an armed group and decided to head toward a cold city where she practically knew no one.  Yet there were still opportunities to start from scratch, so she decided to finish her studies and pursue nursing.  What she enjoys most about CampoAlto is having the opportunity to make her dream a reality.  Sometimes she lacks the necessary funding to continue toward her goal, but she is strong and insists on doing what she likes to do most.

loans.use: to pay for her studies at CampoAlto.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 47-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has six children. The youngest is eight. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various goods including beverages, noodles, biscuits, sugar, canned goods, shampoo and detergents. 

To fill her store with stock, she requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more supplies like beverages, noodles, canned goods, toiletries and dry goods. In the future, Rubina would like to become successful entrepreneur and also support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like beverages, noodles, canned goods, toiletries and dry goods.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino is 47 years old, married to Cely and they are blessed with three children. The family lives in Alcala. They plant and harvest rice to sell as source of income. He usually gets an average net income of PHP 15,000 per crop and this is very helpful in sustaining their needs. 

Rufino is now taking a loan to invest in developing his crop output. He will buy fertilizers and insecticides for his farm. This will help improve his crop growth and nutrition. He will pay back this loan in full if it will be granted and will continue striving hard for the development of his business and overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his farm.

loans.name: Rebenia

texts.en:
Rebenia is a 48-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is the mother of six children. The oldest child is 25 while the youngest is seven. She raises and sells hogs. She has been raising hogs for quite some period of time.

Rebenia lacks funds to sustain her hog-raising activity. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy pig feed so the pigs will grow healthy and strong. In the future, Rebenia would like to build a piggery and also gain a steady source of income.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Sernalin

texts.en:
Sernalin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling salt in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock to sell.

Sernalin successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Sernalin's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of salt to sell.

loans.name: Roselanie

texts.en: Roselanie is borrowing a new loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fishing gear and other equipment.  She had a prior loan for her fishing business through Kiva's partner NWTF. The fishing business continues to provide Roselanie and her family with the opportunity to increase their income and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Kufuna

texts.en:
Kufuna is a businesswoman who is very hardworking.  She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kufuna has operated a charcoal selling business for the past two years; her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to weed and remove trees from his field.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 42 years old and is married with 3 children. She runs a stationery shop and has been doing this business for the past year. She earns a monthly income of 30,000 Kenya Shillings (KES).

She plans to use this loan to purchase more stationary to sell in her business. This stationary includes exercise books, text books, charts, color pencils and printing papers as well as other items. This is her first loan with KADET LTD and she will use the anticipated profits to add more books to her shop. 

Nancy hopes to be a supplier of books and other stationery material in schools and colleges and to have a prosperous life.

loans.use: to buy more stationery to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married with four children and resides in Pandahan, SND, Lanao del Norte along with her family. Her husband is a fisherman. She buys and sells fish in their community while her husband does fishing to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

She joined Gata Daku MPC in 2011 and has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used to improve her business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. She plans to use the additional generated income as additional capital. She wants to improve the general living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a very hardworking and innovative woman who owns a primary school that goes from standard one to standard five. She wants to expand her school to accommodate more students. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase furniture such as chairs, desks and tables for her classrooms. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase furniture such as chairs, desks and tables for her classrooms.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en: Zaina is a hardworking single mother living in Masindi, Uganda. For eight years she has been a farmer, but she also operates a retail shop in order to raise money to meet her daily expenses. Inadequate capital and price fluctuations are her major challenges, while her dream is to become a model farmer in the village and to own a wholesale shop. Zaina intends to use this loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en: Kefa is a hard-working man living in Masindi, Uganda. He operates a retail shop and has been in business for a year. Like most traders, he faces the challenges of price fluctuation and customers not paying on time.  His dreams are to have a wholesale business and also buy land for farming. Kefa intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 27-year-old hardworking married man with a child living in Masindi, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family solely rests on him and his desire is to live a modest life.

For six years he has been serving as a policeman and he was inspired into service by the desire to keep law and order. The low salary and poor working conditions are his major challenges while his dream is to buy land and venture into commercial agriculture.

Emmanuel intends to use the loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew, a 36-year-old father of two children, is married and runs a hotel business in Nairobi. He has been in this business for two years and currently earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES. 

This is his first loan with KADET LTD and he will use it to purchase flour, rice, baking powder and sugar for use in his business. He will use the profits to expand his hotel business by buying more stocks of food and utensils to use.

Mathew's hopes and dreams for the future are to grow his hotel business and to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 45 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are in school. Amelita works very hard to provide for them.

Amelita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. 

Amelita requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase goods for the business like canned goods, soft drinks, chips, soap, etc.

In the future, Amelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase goods for the business like canned goods, soft drinks, chips, soap, etc.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
This is Pamela. She previously accessed a loan that she used to buy food items and ingredients for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a loan of KES 35,000 to buy rice, sugar, beans, and onions for her business. Her profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, and onions for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure and other agricultural supplies to maintain her crops of corn and vegetables.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Amélé vit avec son conjoint et leur enfant de 05ans à Lomé. Elle revend depuis 2000 des pagnes et mèches dans une boutique et sollicite son tout nouveau crédit pour stocker plus de marchandises. Âgée de 31ans, elle assurer voir sa famille s'épanouir et rendre pérenne son activité.
texts.en:
Amélé, age 31, lives in Lomé with her spouse and their 5-year-old child. She has been selling pagnes and hair extensions in a store since 2000. She is seeking a new loan to stock up on merchandise. 

She wants to ensure her family’s well-being and to achieve commercial sustainability.

loans.use: to buy pagnes and hair extensions for resale.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani works hard to support her family. Lani is 40 years old and has four children and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years now.

Lani requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like rice, flour, sugar, milk, etc.

In the future, Lani would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like rice, flour, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Esterlita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Esterlita is borrowing 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Esterlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 41-year-old, hardworking woman with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a salon and sells clothes. With the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children and restock her salon despite challenges of inadequate capital and high competition. Her dreams are to build a permanent residential house, educate her children up to the University and modernize her salon so as to attract more customers.

Grace intends to use the loan to buy cosmetics and hair extensions to use in the salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair extensions to use in the salon.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.fr: Abiba est une femme de 47ans. Mariée, elle a 02 enfants de 27 et 24ans qui sont scolarisés. Pour prêter main forte à son conjoint, elle revend depuis 2008 des produits d'alimentation générale dans un quartier de la ville de Lomé. S'approvisionnant au Grand Marché de Lomé, elle sollicite un premier à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Le profit l'aidera à agrandir son activité et assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en:
Abiba, age 47, is married with two children aged 24 and 27 who have both attended school. To help her husband, she started to sell general food products in a district of Lomé in 2008. She buys her stock at the Grand market of Lomé.

She is seeking a first loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise. The profits earned will allow her to expand her business and to help provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy general grocery products.

loans.name: Celnape

texts.en:
Celnape, 36 years old, is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a lumber yard operator while Celnape operates a general store, selling a variety of food and household products. She has been in business for six years in order to earn a living.

In 2006, Celnape joined GDMPC and she has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used to improve her business. Recently, Celnape is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase livestock feeds, rice and corn grits in addition to her working inventory capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feeds, rice and corn grits.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia, 31, does farming in Kangundo town, where she plants cash crops and rears cattle. She is married and has two children. She has been in the farming business for the past 9 years.

She plans to use this loan to buy farm inputs, including seeds, fertilizer and feed for her cattle. This is her first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children by paying for their school fees.

She hopes to be a successful businesswoman and thereby be able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Gay

texts.en:
Gay is 40 years old and a widow with four children who are in school.

Gay works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional lipstick, lotion, body spray, deodorant, etc., to sell.

Gay has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling business for four years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Gay aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional lipstick, lotion, body spray, deodorant, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian is a 27-year-old ambitious man with three children living in Masindi, Uganda.

He is a distributor of herbal health products and he has been in business for three years now. Stiff competition and customers failing to pay on time are his major challenges, while his dream is to trade wholesale and venture into new markets.

Brian intends to use the loan to buy more herbal health products to sell.

loans.use: to buy herbal health products to sell.

loans.name: Jovelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jovelia works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Jovelia is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase ingredients like pork, chicken, spices, vegetables, etc., for her restaurant business.

Jovelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like pork, chicken, spices, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel sigue con la misma actividad de la confección de chamarras deportivas,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de tela por cantidad para la confección de sus prendas, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito ya que utilizo en lo mismo compra de telas,  incremento sus pedidos y por ende sus ingresos ya  tiene mucha clientela.
texts.en: Daniel continues with the same business, making sports jackets. This time he is requesting a loan in order to buy fabric in bulk for making his clothes. He states that it went very well for him with the last loan, which he also used for buying fabric. His orders and his income increased, and now he has a large clientele.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fabric

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Âgée de 32ans, épouse d'un revendeur  Ama elle aussi s'est lancée dans le commerce. Elle revend des produits cosmétiques et des mèches au marché. N'arrivant pas à mieux répondre aux besoins des clients à cause du manque de marchandises, elle sollicite son tout premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des produits cosmétiques et des mèches. Comme perspectives d'avenir, Ama souhaite avoir une activité élargit et l'épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Ama, age 32, is married to a reseller. She started her own commercial activity, selling cosmetics and hair extensions at the market. Unable to meet customer demand due to insufficient stock, she is seeking a first loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise. 

In the long term, Ama would like to expand her business and ensure her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair extensions for resale.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 32-year-old, married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has three children, ages 14, 12, and 9 years old.

Julieta goes fishing. She sells fish to earn for a living. Together with her husband, they work hand-in-hand to support the needs of their children. 

Julieta requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fishing materials, like fish net, to improve her catch. 

In the future, Julieta would like to expand her fishing business to support the study of her children and also to purchase a motorboat.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, like fish net.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a 44-year-old  married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is the mother of three children, ages 10, 18 and 21. 

She engages in food vending. She makes suman (made from glutinous rice cooked in coconut milk, and often steamed, wrapped in buli or palm). She has been selling suman for three years. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Julie lacks the finances to sustain her daily living. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy glutinous rice, sugar and food for the family so that she can serve her customers and get back to her normal livelihood activity.

In the future, Julie would like to expand her food-vending business to have an additional source of livelihood and continue to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy glutionous rice, sugar and food for the family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor to pick the coffee at harvest time.

loans.name: Gladis Ondina

texts.es:
Doña Gladis tiene 37 años de edad es agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 4 hijos de los cuales tres viven con ella y están estudiando ya que el mayor esta fuera del hogar. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo y su apoyo es su único apoyo para las diferentes actividades del campo es su compañero de hogar el cual trabaja en una maquila de la zona desempeñándose como operario de costura. Desde muy pequeña aprendió las diferentes actividades en el campo para el cuido y trato del café ya que sus padres le enseñaron desde muy pequeña siendo en su familia una tradición. La tierra que ella trabaja en compañía de sus hijos y su pareja es propia gracias a una herencia de sus padres y la otra parte es comprada la cual está ubicada a una hora de camino en la cual se involucran en tiempo de corte y recolección del grano todos como familia. 

Sus sueños son los de poder convertirse en una de las mejores productoras de café de la zona, poder exportar su producto a otros países y generar empleo e ingresos para su familia y hogar. Como madre darles a sus hijos una excelente educación a nivel superior con la cual puedan enfrentar los problemas de manera favorable y puedan ser alguien en la vida. Por esa razón ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas que ayudaran a que sus cultivos de café y viveros crezcan y cultiven una semilla de calidad para los compradores finales.
texts.en:
Gladis is 37 years old, and she is a farmer and housekeeper. She is the mother of four children, three of whom live with her and are in school. The oldest no longer lives at home. She completed primary education. Her partner is her only support for the different farming activities. He works in a "maquila" [a manufacturing operations free-trade zone] as a sewing operator. 

At a very young age, Gladis started to learn all of the different farming activities related to caring for and growing coffee. Her parents began to teach her to farm when she was young because it is a family tradition. The land where she works along with her children and partner is their own, thanks to an inheritance from her parents. They bought the other part of land, and it is located an hour's walk way. They invest time in cutting and collecting beans as a family.

Gladis's dreams are to become one of the best coffee producers of her region, to be able to export her product to other countries, and to generate employment and income for her family and her household. As a mother, she wants to give her children an excellent education up to a high level, with which they will be able to deal with problems well and be someone in their lives. For this reason, she asked for a loan from the COMIXMUL co-operative, in order to buy agricultural inputs. These will help her to grow her coffee crops and nurseries, and to develop quality seeds for the final purchasers.

loans.use: to buy inputs to grow her coffee crops.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 30 years old and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. 

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, chips, noodles, egg, etc.

In the future Arlene would like to save enough money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, chips, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Daisy works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from fish vending.  

Daisy is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her vegetable-vending business.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 55 years old and married. She has four children.

Julia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising pigs. 

Julia requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase goods like biscuits, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

She has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Julia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods like biscuits, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois qui abrite le groupe a été créé le 15 mai 2008  jour de  son inauguration. Les femmes qui le composent sont très dynamiques de plus elles sont très solidaires. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce. 

Madame Aïssatou  (assise à l’extrême droite dans la deuxième rangée levant la main), est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 01 fille. Elle est vendeuse de divers produits : thé, sucre, bonbons, biscuits et cigarette qu’elle achète en gros au marché central de la région.  Pour revente au détail dans son village.

 Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter : 02 cartons de thé de deux marques différentes à 8 000 F CFA, 01 sac de sucre à 22 500 F CFA et 05 grosses de cigarette à 4 500 la grosse.


Les bénéfices réalisés serviront à soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la scolarité des enfants et de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" which houses this group was created on May 15, 2008. The women who comprise its members operate a variety of small-scale retail businesses. They are very dynamic and supportive of each other. 

Aïssatou, in the second row on the far right with her hand raised, is the group's leader. She is a 33-year-old married mother of five children, four boys and one girl. She sells various products: tea, sugar, candy, biscuits and cigarettes, which she buys in bulk at region's central market to sell in the village.

With her new loan, she intends to buy two different boxes of tea for 8,000 FCFA, one bag of sugar for 22,500 FCFA, and five cartons of cigarettes for 4,500 FCFA. The profits will assist her husband in providing for their children's education and daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase tea, sugar and cigarettes.

loans.name: Sadelly Roxana

texts.es: La Sra. Sadelly sigue con la misma actividad de la siembra de variedad de vegetales y legumbres,  ella  es agricultora desde hace ya bastante tiempo, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de semillas para la siembra de maíz, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la siembra de papa también comprara semillas y para el preparado de la tierra, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que está creciendo y mejorando su actividad.
texts.en:
Sadelly continues to grow a variety of vegetables and legumes. She has been a farmer for quite a while now, and she says she did well with the previous loan, which she used to buy corn seeds for planting.

Sadelly is requesting this loan to buy potato seeds and to prepare the land for planting. She says she is grateful for the help to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and to prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Tugume Group

texts.fr:
Médiatrice fait partie du groupe  Tugume et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a 23 ans et est mariée à Thérence un commerçant.

Elle  fait le commerce des médicaments des animaux domestiques  depuis  9 ans. 

Elle est à son onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter  son capital et acheter  beaucoup de médicaments des animaux domestiques à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Le gain de son commerce lui ont permis d’acheter une vache, 4 porcs, et des poules.
texts.en:
Médiatrice, age 23, is a member of the group Tugume. She lives in Gitega. She is married to a merchant named Thérence.

Médiatrice has been selling medicine for domestic animals for nine years. This is her 11th loan cycle with Turame, and she will use her credit to bolster her working capital. She plans to stock up on domestic animal medicine for resale, thereby boosting her revenue. 

The profits earned through her activity have allowed her to buy a cow, four pigs and some chickens.

loans.use: to stock up on domestic animal medicine for resale.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Angelica sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de abarrotes y refrescos,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como abarrotes y galletas por mayor ya que incremento sus ventas y desea surtir su tienda, se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Angelica continues with the same activity, selling staple products in her neighbourhood store. She says her last loan went well. She used the money to purchase groceries and soft drinks. 

At this time, she is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise such as groceries and biscuits at wholesale as it increases her sales and she wants to stock her store. 

She is happy and thankful for the opportunity that she has been given to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Adakou

texts.fr: Âgée de 24ans,Adakou vit avec son conjoint et son enfant d'un an à Lomé. Pour aider son mari dans les charges familiales, elle a commencé en 2012 par vendre des céréales(mais, haricot) à domicile.  Afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, elle sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises. Comme perspectives d'avenir, elle souhaite devenir grossiste et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Adakou is 24 years old and lives with her husband and their one-year-old child in Lomé. In order to help her husband with the family expenses, she began selling cereals (corn, beans) from her home in 2012. In order to better meet the needs of her customers, she is requesting a first loan to be able to purchase more merchandise. Looking to the future, she hopes to become a wholesaler and to ensure the prosperity of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Maombi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Rukiramuka est secrétaire de l’association  d’affaire  «Maombi», senior entrepreneur, expérimentée et  mère de 7 enfants parmi les quels 4 étudient et d’autres sont encore gosses. Son conjoint est un chômeur depuis plusieurs années, toute fois, il réalise de petites commissions sur les ventes des parcelles dans l’opération au quelle, il a été facilitateur. La cliente est vendeuse des pommes de terre. Elle vend aussi les braises. Elle installe ses marchandises  au marché public, parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a environ 16 ans qu’elle exerce ces activités. Ce nouveau crédit va lui servir d’acheter 4 sacs de pommes de terre et 2 sacs de braises. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses  enfants.  Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Rukiramuka is the secretary of the Maombi group, an experienced entrepreneur, and mother of 7 children, 4 of whom attend school and the others of whom are still young children. Her partner has been unemployed for several years; however he earns small commissions on the sale of parcels of land by the business he used to work in.

Rukiramuka is a reseller of potatoes. She also sells charcoal. She sets up her wares in the public market, and sometimes from her home. Rukiramuka began her business with her own funds received from her husband. Later, she was the recipient of a loan from the microfinance organization Hekima. She has been in business for about 16 years. This new loan will allow her to purchase 4 bags of potatoes and 2 bags of charcoal. With this, she hopes to grow her business, and provide for her children's schooling and food. In closing, she is very grateful to Hekima for their support in microcredit for small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 4 bags of potatoes and 2 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 22ans, Kokou pour subvenir à ses besoins revend des matériaux d'électricité dans une boutique. Le premier crédit sollicité lui permettra d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire ses clients. A l'avenir, il espère agrandir sa boutique et subvenir encore plus à ses besoins.
texts.en: A young man of 22 years, Kokou resells electronics materials in a shop in order to support himself. This first requested loan will allow him to purchase more merchandise in order to meet the needs of his customers. In the future, he hopes to expand his shop and be able to better provide for himself.

loans.use: to purchase electronics materials

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a farmer in Kangundo town where he grows cash crops such as maize, bananas and vegetables as well as keeps dairy cattle. He is 29 years old and married with two children. His wife also supports him by running a retail shop.

He has been in this business for five years and it has been profitable. This being his second loan term with KADET LTD, he plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow.This will enable him to get more milk to sell. He will use the generated profits to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, Jacob hopes to expand his farming business, make more income and be able to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita works hard to support her family. Cristita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Cristita requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase margarine, yeast, baking powder, sugar, banana leaves, etc.

She has been in this business for 19 years now.

In the future, Cristita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase margarine, yeast, baking powder, sugar, banana leaves, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 32-year-old married woman with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop where she sells general merchandise.The business has been very lucrative and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Price fluctuation is her major challenge while her dreams are to own a wholesale shop and educate her children up to the university. Margret intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has piped water but no electricity. 

Rosemary has operated a beauty salon business for the past three months. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the 80,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
Doña María Catalina tiene 59 años de edad es madres de 7 hijos los cuales 3 viven con ella, todos trabajan y tres viven con ella a parte también vive con ella un nieto el cual estudia y ayuda con las diferentes actividades del campo al salir de sus actividades estudiantiles. Ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra en compañía de su conyugue hace más de 5 años quien falleció hace unos años atrás. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona en busca de un producto cómodo y de calidad siendo el de ella uno de los más buscados en la zona por su calidad, cuidado e higiene y transparencia al momento de su corta y productos a utilizar para su limpieza. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 5 minutos de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada en compañía de sus hijos para elaborar las diferentes actividades como la limpieza, aplicación de abono, fertilizantes, fungicidas, herbicidas, etc. 
 
Sus planes para el futuro es poder expandir sus cultivos por medio de la compra de tierra para poder cultivar más café y generar más ingresos para su familia y para su hogar. Ella sueña con ser la mejor productora de café de la zona ya que sus metas es poder mientras tenga vida ver salir su producto del país en exportación, fortaleciendo el patrimonio para sus hijos y nietos. Es por ello que Doña María Catalina ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para comprar insumos como: urea, abono, herbicidas, fertilizantes entre otros para proteger su cosecha de café.
texts.en:
Maria Catalina is 59 years old and is the mother of seven children, all of whom work. Three of Maria’s children and one grandchild live with her. Her grandson goes to school, and he helps with various jobs in the fields after he comes home for the day. 

Maria learned to work the land with her husband more than five years ago. Sadly, he died a few years ago. Her customers are coffee buyers who come to the area in search of a high-quality product. She says her coffee is some of the most sought-after in the area because of the careful, hygienic and transparent method she uses to harvest the crop, and the products she uses for maintenance. Maria’s fields are five minutes from her home, and she travels there with her children to do the various jobs to maintain the crop such as applying manure, fertilizers, fungicides and herbicides.

Maria says that her plan for the future is to buy more land to plant a larger coffee crop. She hopes to increase her income. Maria says that she dreams of being the best coffee producer in the area. Her goal is to see her product exported from the country while she is still alive, which she says will strengthen her children’s and grandchildren’s legacy. 

Maria is requesting this loan from Kiva and the field partner to buy urea, manure, herbicide, fertilizer and other agricultural supplies to protect her coffee crop.

loans.use: to buy urea, manure, herbicide, fertilizer and other agricultural supplies to protect her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover treatment expenses for his wife.

loans.name: Nolvia Leccy

texts.es:
Doña Nolvia tiene 30 años de edad es madre de un hijo, ama de casa, agricultora y también se especializa en ventas en una tienda de ropa en la zona donde ella habita. Ella es madre soltera por lo que a diario lucha para que a su hijo no le falte nada tiene 10 años de educación cursando hasta la secundaria pero no pudo continuar por falta de apoyo económico. Ella es una mujer emprendedora por lo que también se dedica a la costura en temporadas siendo sus clientes sus vecinos y familiares, amigos y demás que conocen de su excelente trabajo. Sus cultivos están ubicados a una distancia de 1 kilómetro de su casa de habitación a los cuales en ocasiones se traslada a pie o en moto taxi. 

Ella sueña con construir su casa de habitación de manera propia para su hijo y su familia ofreciendo un techo digno y seguro a su hijo el cual ella como madre de familia tiene mucha fe y confianza de que algún día cuando este mayor será un hombre de bien y una persona preparada. Por esa y muchas razones más ella lucha diariamente y hoy día solicita a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, foliares, formula cafetalera entre otros que aran de sus cultivos más atractivos y confiables para el intermediario-comprador final.
texts.en:
Nolvia, 30, is a mother of one son, a housewife, a farmer and also specializes in sales in a clothing store in the area where she lives. She is a single mother and that is why she fights daily to provide for her son. He has 10 years of education, attending school until secondary level. He couldn't continue for lack of economic support. 

She is an entrepreneur in which she also sews in seasons. Her clients are her neighbours, relatives, friends among others who know her for her excellent work. Her crop is located 1 kilometre from her house where, on occasion, she walks or takes a mototaxi. 

She dreams of building her own house for her son and family, providing dignity and security for her son whom she has a lot of faith and confidence that one day when he is older he will be an accomplished and qualified man. For that and many more reasons she fights daily. 

Now she is requesting a loan from the cooperative COMIXMUL to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, plant and coffee fertilizers among others to make her crops more attractive and reliable for the final intermediary-buyer.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere más capital de trabajo para continuar en el cultivo de granos básicos; esta inversión le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
Comenta el Sr. Alvaro  que el crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar la producción y sus ingresos, estas ganancias la invierte en los gastos del hogar. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares asimismo.
texts.en:
Alvaro recognizes the necessity of applying for a new loan, since he requires more working capital if he is to continue cultivating basic grains. This investment will allow him to buy agricultural inputs such as manure, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides, among other inputs.

Alvaro comments that his previous loan helped him to augment production and improved his income. These earnings were invested in household expenses. Alvaro's economic conditions have improved, as have the circumstances of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides, among other farming inputs for his basic grains.

loans.name: Rudy Nilson

texts.es: El Sr. Rudy tiene 24 años, el  se dedica a la actividad de la pesca  el vive en una isla del lago Titicaca, centro turístico del departamento de La Paz donde ofrecen al público  artesanías  de totoras y en lana, la mayoría de los habitantes de esta isla se dedican a la pesca y el turismo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Rudy va a usar este préstamo para compra de piezas de red para usar en la pesca, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumentar la pesca e incrementar su capital  de trabajo, el Sr. Rudy enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener una mejor producción y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando en su trabajo ya que este es su único ingreso para mantener a su familia, Sr. Rudy es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Rudy is 24 years old. He is a fisherman and lives on an island in Lake Titicaca. It is the touristic center of La Paz Department and handicrafts typically are made from reeds and wool. The majority of the island's inhabitants make their living from fishing or tourism. 

This is Rudy's second loan from the institution and he will use it to buy netting to use in fishing, The reason he needs this loan is to increase the amount of catch and increase his working capital. The challenge he faces in his business is to have better production. He will use the loan to continue improving in his work as it is the only means of support he has for his family. Rudy is very hard-working and is grateful for the opportunity he is being offered with this loan.

loans.use: to buy netting for Silverside fishing.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel  de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su compañero de vida,  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela por su amabilidad a la hora de vender e higiene para elaborar los alimentos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Isabel esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz  por mayor y cal para seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi podrá seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Isabel is 32 years old and lives with her life partner and two children in their own home. For the past few years she has been making and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her home. She has lots of clients due to her friendliness while selling and her cleanliness in preparing the food. She manages to pay some of the household expenses with the profits of her sales.

Isabel is requesting a loan to buy corn wholesale and buy lime so she can continue with her business. This is her only source of employment and she wants to continue offering her family a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and to buy lime.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente es del sector de Isla Trinitaria en Guayaquil.  Empezó hace 3 años, haciendo carreras después del trabajo para mejorar su economía familiar.  Además es marino, ya que es la profesión que le gustó desde pequeño.  Es casado y su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar.  Tiene un hijo de 4 años.  En un futuro le gustaría adecuar su casa con una loza más y poderle brindar un mejor porvenir a su familia.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de partes y reparación de su vehículo.
texts.en: The client is from the Isla Trinitaria area in Guayaquil.  Three years ago he started working as a driver after work in order to improve the family finances.  He is also a seaman because he has liked this profession since he was little.  He is married, and his wife devotes herself to the household chores.  He has a four year old child.  In the future he would like to equip his house with another cement floor and to be able to provide his family with a better future.  He now needs to loan to buy parts and repair his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy parts and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Afya Group

texts.fr: La cliente Vumilia e présidente  du groupe communautaire de crédit  « Afya», senior entrepreneur, expérimentée et  mère de 9 enfants parmi les quels certains étudient et d’autres ont déjà leurs foyers. Son conjoint est un pasteur évangéliste dans une Eglise locale. La cliente est vendeuse des farines de Manioc et de Maïs. Elle installe ses marchandises  au marché public et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari et de son épargne qu’elle s’était constituée dans une activité de vente de pierres (graviers ou cailloux), qu’elle ramassait dans la nature. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a environ 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité de vente de farine. Ce nouveau crédit va lui servir d’acheter 1 sac de farine de Manioc  et 1 sac de farine de Maïs. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir  et construire une maison pour ses  enfants.  Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Vumilia is the president of the community borrowing group Afya, an experienced entrepreneur and businesswoman, and the mother of 9 children, some of whom attend school and others who already have their own households. Her husband is an evangelical minister in a local church. Vumilia is a seller of manioc and corn flours. She sets up her wares in the public market and sometimes from her home.

Vumilia began her business with her own funding received from her husband, as well as from savings that she had accumulated in her previous business selling stones (gravel and pebbles) that she gathered outside. Later, she received a loan from the microfinance organization Hekima. She has been in the flour selling business for about 10 years.

This new loan will allow Vumilia to purchase 1 bag of manioc flour and 1 bag of corn flour. With this, she hopes to grow her business, and to provide food and schooling and build a house for her children. In closing, she is extremely grateful to Hekima for their support of small businesses through microcredit.

loans.use: to purchase 1 bag of manioc flour and 1 bag of corn flour

loans.name: Jérome

texts.fr: Ce monsieur nommé Jérôme est âgé de 39ans. Il en charge 03 personnes(sa femme et ses enfants de 12 et 09ans qui sont scolarisés). Il est couturier et en même temps détenteur d'un bar depuis 2012 dans lequel il vend de la boisson et de la nourriture. Pour mieux satisfaire ses clients, il sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des boissons. Il espère voir sa famille s'épanouir et agrandir son activité.
texts.en: Jérôme is 39 years old. He has 3 people in his care (his wife and two children, ages 12 and 9, who attend school.) He has been a tailor in addition to running a bar since 2012, in which he sells both food and drink. To better meet the needs of his customers, he is requesting a first loan in order to purchase beverages. He hopes to see his family prosper, and to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase beverages

loans.name: Jose Ramiro

texts.es: Jose de 31 años de edad se dedica desde hace 7 años a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz y frijol esos años de experiencia le han llevado a tener las mejores cosechas por esa razón tiene mucha clientela que lo busca, también por la amabilidad y los buenos precios, su cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, porque también sale a comercializarlos a los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, el esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. para seguir con su siembra y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Jose is 31 years old. For the past seven years he has been farming, especially planting corn and beans. His years of experience have allowed him to enjoy better harvests and for this reason he has lots of clients who seek him out. Also he is friendly and offers reasonable prices. He stores his harvest in the container shown in the photo as he also sells in the markets close to his residence. He pays for the household expenses with what he makes from his harvest. He lives in his own house along with his wife and two children aged 7 and 3 years old. 

Jose is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, etc so he can continue farming and provide his family a more stable income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, etc.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, who is 46 years old, is a single mother of two children. She runs a green grocery shop, which she has been doing for 5 years. She gets 3,000 Kenya Shillings monthly. 

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD, and she will use it to purchase more vegetables to sell in her grocery. She also plans to buy potatoes, tomatoes and fruits. She will use her profits to take her child to college.

Regina's future hopes and dreams are to open another business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes, fruits, and stocks of vegetables to sell in her green grocery shop.

loans.name: Preciosa

texts.en:
Preciosa is 40 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school.

Preciosa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoos, groceries, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc.

Preciosa has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and earns an income from buy and sell ready to wear.

Preciosa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoos, groceries, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a business minded wife, selling viand in her cafeteria. She is married to a motorcycle driver and they live happily in San Isidro, Pagadian City. She has been in her business for five years to make a living. 

She had joined Gata Daku MPC recently and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase assorted raw ingredients. 

She wants to see her children successful and be able to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase assorted raw ingredients for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La cliente corresponde al sector de Isla en Guayaquil.  Empezó hace varios años atrás cuando instaló un gabinete de belleza.  Tiempo después pudo montar un taller de costura en el cual elabora sábanas, camisetas y cortinas.  Con esto pudo mantener y sustentar los gastos de su hogar.  No es casada pero tiene un hijo de 15 años.  Desea a futuro poder gozar de buena salud, tener un local grande para poderle dar todo lo necesario a su familia.  Por ahora desea invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de materia prima para la confección de sus productos.
texts.en: The client is from the Isla area of Guayaquil.  She started several years ago when she set up a beauty salon.  Sometime after that she was able to set up a seamstress shop where she makes sheets, t-shirts, and curtains.  With this she was able to maintain and support the household expenses.  She is not married, but she has a 15 year old son.  In the future she wishes to enjoy good health and to have a large place where she is able to give her family everything it needs.  For now, she wishes to use the loan to buy raw material to make her products.

loans.use: to buy raw material.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 32 years old and married, with two children, one child in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Mylene runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as canned  goods, milk, coffee, spices, chips, etc.

Mylene has been in this business for two years.

In the future Mylene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, such as canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, chips, etc.

loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
Antonietta is 44 years old and married, with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Antonietta has a restaurant business in the Philippines.   She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy kitchenware and ingredients for her restaurant.

Antonietta has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Antonietta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family using the previous loan she received, thanks to her hard work.

She is now asking for a loan to buy ingredients used to make her local brew. She appreciates Kiva and Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make her local brew.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman who is very hard-working.

She sells second-hand clothes, going from door to door to her neighbors and also to passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that Elizabeth is requesting, she wants to purchase more bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her business.

She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob, a father of five, is a community elder and a resident of the Mukuru informal settlement in Nairobi, Kenya. Due to his responsibility to provide for his family, Jacob runs a small egg supplying business in his neighborhood. He is also the chair of a local self-help group, which pools funds to help members invest in or start businesses. Because of his active participation in community activities and his desire to provide for his family, Jacob has singled out various business ideas which he believes will generate enough income to enable him and his family to live in comfort. One that particularly stood out to him was Fresh Life toilets.

Jacob seeks a loan to fund the purchase of two Fresh life toilets. He believes that the need for sanitation facilities in his area is an opportunity for him to succeed in the sanitation business. He hopes that he will expand his franchise in future to enable him to comfortably pay for his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Shenee

texts.en: Shenee is a 20-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol and a mother of a 1-year-old child. She engages in fishing and sells fish and crab to earn a living. Her husband is also a fisherman. She has been selling fish for more than 2 years. Shenee lacks capital to purchase materials to sustain her livelihood activity. She requested a loan of 5000 PHP to buy a crab net, lift weights, and nylon to improve her catch. In the future, Shenee would like to expand her fishing business to support her growing child and provide it with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a crab net, lift weights, and nylon

loans.name: William

texts.es: El Sr. William sigue con la misma actividad que es la venta de madera, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de madera, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mas  madera al por mayor para surtir su negocio  se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que está creciendo y mejorando su actividad.
texts.en: William continues with the same activity: lumber sales.  He relates that he did well with his previous loan because he used it to buy lumber.  On this occasion he’s requesting the loan to buy more lumber at wholesale to stock his business.  He feels happy and grateful for the opportunity being provided because he’s growing and improving his activity.

loans.use: to buy lumber at wholesale.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en:
Tim is 61 years old. She is married to a kind husband and has nine adult children. She has collaborated with her husband to develop productive land for rice farming and to raise their children. Having been in the farming business more than 30 years, she has gained valuable experience to go far in this occupation and is able to make a net profit of $5 per day. She has taught this to her children and also given a few plots of land to her married children.

As of now, she needs a loan amounting to $300 to build a latrine in her home. By having a latrine for household, she can keep her environment clean, protect her family from spreading diseases and increase their personal hygiene. Tim is very happy and thankful, because with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate, different from its general loan. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a latrine in her home.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es: Martha de 29 años de edad es una mujer que ha luchado por sacar adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo tiene un puesto de venta de comida elaborada con elote como: tamales, riguas, tortas, elotes y atol, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia es muy transitado y esa es una ventaja para poder vender, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo ha logrado solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 12 y 7 años de edad ellos actualmente estudian, Martha esta solicitando un crédito para la comprar de elotes por mayor, leche y queso y asi seguir con su negocio para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Martha, 29, is woman who’s striven with much effort to move her family forward.  She has a food stand selling food items made of corn: tamales, ‘riguas’ [Salvadoran corn cakes], cakes, corn-on-the-cob and ‘atol’ [corn and flour drink]. 

Her business is located in a very busy market near her place of residence which is quite an advantage when it comes to sales.  She uses what she earns from her work to cover some of her household expenses.  

She lives in a house of her own with her husband and two children who are 12 and 7 years of age; they are currently attending school.  

Martha’s asking for a loan to buy corn at wholesale, milk and cheese to continue in business to give her family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy corn, milk and cheese at wholesale.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Leticia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a cassava production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase empty sacks and to repair machinery for her cassava production business.

Leticia successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is getting a new loan in order to build her business. NWTF is re-listing Leticia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase empty sacks and to repair machinery for her cassava production business.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is married and lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water. She operates a green grocery shop selling to her neighbors and passersby. The major challenge she faces is high competition from other green grocers

Nyamvula wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions with the loan that she is requesting. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en:
Milicent appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.

She is requesting for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase cloth material and sewing threads for her business. 

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana is the only one who brings an income home. Her husband had an operation in his skull and brain about three years ago and, since then, he hasn’t been able to do much.

 “There are times that I break down in tears because I carry this entire burden. I’ve got to generate an income for my family of two school-aged children and a sick husband, by putting too much physical labor into it. There are so many days that I feel very down, but this is not helpful and I know it, so I try to lift my spirits and keep going in order to provide for my family,” said Adriana, with her eyes full in tears. 

Adriana wants to buy a dairy cow from her neighbor who is immigrating soon and he is selling it at a cheaper price, thus, she wants to take advantage of the deal. She also wants to buy some feed for her animals with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and some feed.

loans.name: Juan Evangelista

texts.es: Don Juan de 55 años de edad es un hombre muy trabajador, responsable y honesto, desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, frijol y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están  cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene  de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos quienes le ayudan en la siembra, Don Juan está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. y así seguir con sus cultivos para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Juan, 55, is a hardworking, responsible, honest man who has worked for several years in agriculture growing corn, beans and sorghum.  He sells his products in various markets near his place of residence. 

He uses what he earns from his sales to cover some of his household expenses.  He lives in his own house with his wife and two children who help him with the crops.

Juan’s asking for a loan to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicide, etc. to continue with his crops to earn higher profits and give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia Alicia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de carne y quinua,la socia vende en diferentes lugares,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la carne y quinua.La socia solicita el credito para comprar carne y quinua.

La socia se siente agradecida con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alicia continues to engage in her business of selling meat and quinoa in different places.  She works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M.  Alicia has been in business for several years and is doing very well.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell meat and quinoa.  

Alicia is requesting a loan in order to buy meat and quinoa.  She is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy meat and quinoa to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is requesting a loan of Ksh. 50,000 to purchase cooking oil and sacks of potatoes. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She hopes that through this loan, she can increase her income further and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: Kevin resides in Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur with his family. To make a living, he operates a 'sari sari' store in their community. He has an only child to support and aside from this, he wants to save for its future. He borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to improve his business. The amount of 5,000 PHP will be used to purchase soft drinks, canned goods and pastries for sale. He hopes to earn more income and use it to improve the general living situation of his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock like canned goods, etc.

location.town: Panduma Sr. Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Devi

texts.en:
Devi runs a small stall which sells  mobile phone airtime credits. Devi lives in Serang, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Devi is married and lives with four persons in the family home. 

Devi began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to try the mobile air time business. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last month, she has had around $ 38 - 40/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to make more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
