Zawadi is a very hardworking woman. Over the years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Zawadi dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions

loans.name: Rien

texts.en:
Rien, 33, is married and has two school-aged children. She is a diligent woman in a farming business and grows rice on her land which is in Bakan district of Pursat province. Through her hardships and perseverance in this field, she is able to produce a reasonable income to cover her family’s expenses. She has been doing this business for almost 13 years.

The reason she is requesting a loan is to have enough money to build a latrine for use in the family. She realizes that the latrine is very important for her family, and most residents living in her commune have built latrines to promote their health and personal hygiene. This has encouraged her to have this loan to improve her living conditions as other families have done. She is a responsible, hard-working person who is grateful for the support she receives from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to build a latrine for  family use.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan de 28 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus hijo de 2 años de edad, el se dedica a la venta de minutas desde hace varios años vende forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su casa, tiene mucha clientela pues es un alimento muy vendible y lo vende a buen precio, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gasto de su hogar, Juan esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hielo por mayor, frutas, y jaleas de diferentes sabores para seguir con su negocio y asi poder llevar el pan diario a su hogar.
texts.en: Juan, who is 28 years old, lives in his own house with his partner and their son who is 2 years old. He has been dedicated to selling snow cones for various years. He sells on foot in the different neighborhoods that are near his house. He has a lot of customers since it is a very sellable food and he sells it at a good price. With what he obtains from sales he manages to cover his bills. Juan is requesting a loan to buy ice at wholesale, fruit and jellies in different flavors to continue with his business and be able to bring home the daily bread.

loans.use: to buy ice at wholesale, fruit and jellies of different flavors.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en: Richel, a 19-year-old student of Souther Mindanao College ( SMC) studying for a  BSBA Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. Her mother is a businesswoman while his father is a fisherman. Sometimes, she helps her mother in her business to earn extra income. She joined Gata Daku MPC in order to gain access to micro finance services and now, Richel has borrowed a loan of 14,000 PHP to  pay the school tuition in her first semester  Business Administration course. She is hopeful to gain success from her effort and be able to find work related to her course in the near future.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition in her first semester

loans.name: Rosa Alvires

texts.es: Doña Rosa de 43 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable tanto en el trabajo como con su familia, desde hace 14 años tiene un puesto de comida cerca de la alcaldía de donde ella reside, tiene mucha clientela por ser un lugar muy transitado, por su amabilidad y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene logra cubrir los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos de 10 y 22 años de edad, doña Rosa  esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como pollos, carnes, frutas, verduras, utensilios de cocina, etc. para poder atender mejor a sus clientes y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a sus hijos una mejor vida.
texts.en: Doña Rosa, age 43, is a woman who is very hard-working and responsible with both her work and her family. She has had a food stall near the city hall where she lives. She has a large clientele because this is a high-traffic area, because of her kindness, and because of her good prices. She is able to cover her household costs with her income. She lives in her own home with her two children, ages 10 and 22. Rosa is requesting a loan for the purchase of more products like chicken, meat, fruit, vegetables, kitchen utensils, etc. in order to better  serve her clients and thus obtain a better income to give her children a better life.

loans.use: to buy more products like chicken, meat, fruit, vegetables, kitchen utensils, etc.

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en: Ronel is a 17-year-old student of Philippine Technological & Marine Sciences (PTMS) studying an automotive course. His parents are already separated but it never made him stop his dream. Despite it, he continues to carry on his studies. He joined Gata Daku MPC and took advantage of a 10,000 PHP loan to pay the school tuition fees in his first semester automotive course. He is thankful to GDMPC that it helps him to pursue his ambition. He wants to be successful and able to improve their living situation.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees in his first-semester automotive course.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is married and has two children, one in school and the other still underage. She lives at her  own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past one year, she has operated a 'bodaboda' (motorcycle) transport business . Her potential customers are town dwellers. She cites high cost of maintenance cost being her major challenge.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Klodiana

texts.en:
Klodiana wants to start up her own little clothing repair and alterations services activity and she is seeking lenders' generosity to achieve her goal. 

“I had been thinking this for a while, yet, I knew that I was not eligible for any loans due to my economical condition. When I was told from the loan officers of VisionFund Albania, that Kiva had made possible such a loan, I got really happy. I am in my early 30s and having young children, operating the activity from home is a good opportunity for me and the kids.  There is no one at the moment offering such services in our village, so this would work in my favor.  Thus, I will be very appreciative to all those good people who will consider helping me out financially,” Klodiana said, beaming.

loans.use: to start her clothing repair and alterations services

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha, age 54, is from the Kaspi district. He is married with a 19-year-old daughter who is a student. The only one who makes money in the household is Vazha’s wife, who works at the local municipality. Her monthly salary is nearly 240 USD, which is hardly enough to cover everyday costs. Vazha is jobless and he decided to start a service business.

With the received startup credit, he will purchase an argon welding machine and serve the locals as a welder for a service fee in return. He used to work in that field and has enough experience in soldering. Vazha hopes that his initiative will be profitable and that he will generate an income to satisfy the needs of his family members.

loans.use: to purchase an argon welding machine

loans.name: Konomi

texts.en:
Konomi is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a motorcycle business. She faces a major challenge of motorcycle breakdown and muddy roads during the rainy season. She dreams of buying a new motorcycle and developing herself.

With the loan of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Catalina Rosa

texts.es: Doña Catalina de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y su  nieta, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado que se encuentra  cerca de su casa, tiene mucha clientela por su amabilidad y buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña Catalina está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería: tomates, papas,  cebollas, chiles, mangos, jocotes, etc. y así tener más variedad y poder atender mejor a sus clientes, para obtener más ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Doña Catalina, age 63, lives in her own home with her son and granddaughter. She sells fruits and vegetables in the market located near her home. She has a large clientele because of her kindness and good prices. With her income from her work she is able to cover some household costs. Catalina is requesting a loan for the purchase of more merchandise: tomato, potato, onion, chilli, mango, jocote, etc. This way she will have more variety and be able to provide better customer service. This will allow her to obtain a greater income and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tomato, potato, onion, chilli, mango, jocote, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta es una persona muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable, con esfuerzos a logrado poner una pequeña panadería en su casa donde elabora pan dulce y pan francés, la cual le deja muy buenas ganancias que le sirven para solventar los gatos que se le presentan  en su hogar, vive en casa de su madre con su esposo y su hijo de 3 años de edad, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, manteca, canela, aceite, maíz, leche, etc. pues esos son algunos de los ingredientes que utiliza para elaborar el pan  y asi seguir con su negocio que es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en: This borrower is a very hardworking, honest, and responsible person.  With a lot of effort, she managed to set up a small bakery in her house where she makes sweet bread and French bread.  This business gives her very good earnings, enabling her to cover the household expenses.  She lives in her  mother's house with her husband and their 3 year-old child.  She is requesting a loan to buy flour, butter, cinnamon, cooking oil, corn, milk, and other products, as these are some of the ingredients that she uses to make her bread.  This way she can continue with her business, which is her only source of income, so that she and her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, cinnamon, cooking oil, corn, milk, and other products,

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija de cuatro años de edad, ella se dedica a la  elaboración de pan y quesadillas de maíz y arroz desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela por su amabilidad y  buenos precios, con lo que gana de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo que es albañil ayudan a solventar algunos gastos que se les presentan en su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, arroz y también mejorar el horno que utiliza que es el que muestra la fotografía ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client lives in her own home with her husband and four-year-old daughter. She makes bread and quesadillas from corn and rice. She has done this for several years, and she has a large clientele because of her kindness and good prices. With her earnings from her sales, and with her husband's support (he is a bricklayer), they are able to cover some of their household costs. The client is requesting a loan for the purchase of flour, sugar, and rice, and to improve the oven that she uses (pictured), since this is her only source of work. This way, she will obtain a better income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and rice, and to improve her oven.

loans.name: Claricia

texts.es: Claricia se dedica a la venta de cerdos desde hace varios años, comercializa sus cerdos en los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su hijo y su esposo, clarisia está solicitando un crédito para la compra de vitaminas y concentrado y así poder seguir con su trabajo y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Claricia has sold hogs for several years. She sells her hogs in the markets located near her home. She has a lot of clientele because of her good prices and kindness. With her income, she is able to cover some of her household costs. She lives in her own home with her child and husband. Claricia is requesting a loan for the purchase of vitamins and concentrate in order to be able to continue with her work and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and concentrate.

loans.name: Rosa Maura

texts.es: Rosa de 57 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable con su trabajo y su hogar, desde hace 30 años que se dedica a la crianza de ganado y a la venta de productos lácteos, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con  su esposo, tiene una hija pero es independiente, doña Rosa está solicitando un crédito para la compra de vitaminas y concentrado para el ganando y asi seguir con su trabajo y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa is 57 years old. She is a very hard working and responsible woman with her job and her home. For 30 years, she has been dedicated to raising cattle and selling dairy products. She has a lot of customers due to the quality of her products and good prices. From what she obtains from sales, she can pay some bills that her home incurs. She lives in her own house with her husband. She has a daughter but she is independent. Rosa is requesting a loan to buy vitamins and concentrates for the cattle and, in this way, continue with her work and given her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and concentrates for the cattle.

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram is 37 years old and the father of three children, of whom all are currently studying in school. For the last nine years, he has earned a living by selling goods from his general store in Mpeketoni, Lamu, where he earns a monthly profit of 13,000 KES. 

Joram  is applying for his fourth loan of KES. 50,000 to purchase additional stock needed for his business. He will use the profit from the business to pay for school fees, purchase food for the family and expand the current business. Joram hopes to own his own supermarket in future so as to improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of goods for his business

loans.name: Assaba

texts.fr: Veuve de 61ans, pour subvenir à ses besoins revend depuis 2005 des ustensiles de cuisine au marché. Manquant de fonds pour satisfaire ses clients, elle sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises.  Elle voudrait à l'avenir devenir grossiste et subvenir à ses besoins habituels.
texts.en: A widow of 61, Assaba has sold kitchen utensils at the market since 2005 to cover her living expenses. She does not have enough funds to satisfy her customers, so she is asking for a first loan from WAGES to buy more merchandise. In future, she would like to become a wholesaler and continue to earn enough to cover her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils made of plastic

loans.name: Ana Carolina

texts.es: Ana de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes, desodorantes, lociones, cremas, etc. tiene mucha clientela por su amabilidad y buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ana esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su negocio, ya si obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad e vida.
texts.en: Ana, age 31, lives in her own home with her husband and daughter. She sells perfume, deodorant, lotion, creams, etc. She has many customers because of her kindness and good prices. With her income she is able to cover some household costs. Ana is requesting a loan for the purchase of more merchandise for her business. This will allow her to obtain a greater income in order to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy perfume, deodorant, lotion, cream, etc, wholesale.

loans.name: Efrain De Los Santo

texts.es: Efraín de 49 años de edad desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de agua de coco, su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada y que es muy buena para el negocio, tiene muy buena clientela por ser un producto muy vendible, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gasto de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa, su hijos y su madres, Efraín esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar cocos por mayor  y seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias y asi poderle ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Efraín is 49 years old. For 8 years he has been dedicated to selling coconut water. His business is located near his place of residence in a well transited area and that is very good for business. He has very good customers since it is a very sellable product. With the earnings he makes, he is able to pay some bills at home. He lives in his own house with his wife, their children and their mothers. Efraín is requesting the loan to be able to buy coconuts at wholesale and to continue with his work that generates good income and therefore be able to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy coconuts at wholesale.

loans.name: Ingrid Monica

texts.es: La Sra. Ingrid  tiene 19 años, ella se dedica  a la elaboración y  venta de queso y leche ya que tiene ganado vacuno, el vive en la localidad de Batallas, la gente de la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  La Sra. Ingrid  utilizara  este préstamo para la compra  de una vaca lechera y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero  para la compra ya que esto le beneficiara de gran manera  ya que  proporcionara  buena cantidad de leche y así de esta manera producir más quesos y leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, La Sra. Ingrid  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado y su deseo es poder producir y elaborar quesos por mayor y ofrecer a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 19 years old. She makes and sells cheese and milk since she owns dairy cattle. She lives in the town of Batallas. People there work in agriculture and animal husbandry. 

This loan is her first cycle with the institution. Ingrid will use this loan to buy a dairy cow; she wants to make the most of this opportunity. Her reason for requesting this loan is that she lacks money for said purchase, which will benefit her greatly since it would provide a good amount of milk so that she can make more cheese and milk and improve her income. 

The business challenge Ingrid faces is the fodder that she must buy every so often. She will use the profits to improve her cattle. Her wish is to be able to produce and make cheese at wholesale and sell it to various markets in the city of La Paz.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Taslima

texts.ru: Таслима добросовестная женщина. Она родилась и выросла в России. Она приехала в Таджикистан 21 лет назад. Она вдова. Таслима имеет 4 детей. Двое из ее детей работают в Российской Федерации. Один из них работает в швейном цехе и другой работает в мясокомбинате. Таслима сама торгует на местном рынке. Она является основной кормилицей в семье. Ее сын приехал несколько месяцев назад и теперь должен обратно уехать в Российскую Федерацию, но не имеет денег для покупки авиабилета. Таслима запрашивает займ на сумму 600 долларов США для покупки авиабилета для сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Taslima is a conscientious person. She was born and grew up in Russia. She moved to Tajikistan 21 years ago. She is a widow, with four children. Two of her children work in the Russian Federation: one works  at a sewing factory and the other in a meat processing plant. Taslima works as a vendor at the local marketplace. She is the main breadwinner in the family. Her son came back a few month ago. He was supposed to return to the Russian Federation but lacks the funds to buy an air ticket. Taslima is requesting a loan in the amount of 600 USD in order to buy an air ticket for her son. She is counting on your kindness and compassion.

loans.use: to buy an air ticket for her son who wants to go to Russia.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra est une femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mère de famille.
Abra travaille comme revendeuse depuis un moment. Elle vend des pagnes pour tous clients à domicile et de façon ambulante Elle achète les produits à Lomé et travaille seule. 
Abra a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Abra voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Abra is a woman of 30 and the mother of a family. She has been selling lengths of colorful African cloth for quite a while, to all comers at her home and also as a hawker. She buys her wares in Lomé and works alone. 
 
Abra has requested her fourth loan from WAGES in order to buy more lengths of cloth. She wants to reinvest in her business. 

In the coming years, Abra would like to open a little shop. She says that with the profit, she expects to cover the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase 'pagnes' (lengths of colorful cloth used in traditional dress)

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase tea leaves, bread, cooking oil, salt, and sugar. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase tea leaves, bread, cooking oil, salt, and sugar

loans.name: Loem's Group

texts.en: A rural villager from Kampong Cham province with his wife and two children, one daughter and one son, Loem is 43 years old. To overcome his family's living situation, Loem works as a construction worker. The current business, which he has been involved with for 25 years, has returned him about 25,000 KHR per day. Loem is a first-time borrower with VisionFund. Now he leads a group of two members to apply for the same loan amount: 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, he will use his loan portion to buy construction supplies for his business. He hopes to make a good income to improve his family's living condition.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for his business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза родилась в 1977 году. Она всегда старается для благополучия своего сына, так как она является единственной кормилицей своего сына. Ее муж умер несколько лет назад. Она вдова и воспитывает сына одна. Фируза имеет высшее образование. Она окончила Налоговый институт. Данное время она работает в сфере суда. Она хорошо знает свою работу и имеет хорошую деловую репутацию. Она использует свою зарплату для покупки всех необходимых средства для проживания. Ее сын просит ее купить кровать, но Фируза не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомон для покупки кровати. Этот займ поможет ей улучшить условия домохозяйства и обрадовать ее сына сироту.
texts.en: Firuza was born in 1977. She always tries to give her son the best, as she is the only caretaker for her son. Her husband died not long ago. She is a widow and is raising her son herself. Firuza has a higher education. She graduated from the Nalog Institute. At this time she works with boats. She knows her work well and has a good business reputation. She uses her income to buy the necessary means for living. Her son asked her to buy a bed, but Firuza doesn't have the money. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Tajikistani Somoni to buy a bed. This loan will allow her to improve their living conditions and please her son who is an orphan.

loans.use: To buy bed for her son

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 28-year-old married man. He has 2 children with ages 1 year and 3 years. He describes himself to be focused. 

David operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motor-rickshaw. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy motorcycles for transporting customers. His business goal is to own a big transport company within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy motorcycles for transporting customers

loans.name: Tror

texts.en:
Tror, a citizen from Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, is 32 years old and a married mother of two children--one son and one daughter. One of them is still in school, while the other is too young for school. She and her husband have been growing rice on one hectare of her farmland for 14 years.

The current business has returned her about 25,000 KHR per day in order to support the rest of her family. This is Tror's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now she is seeking a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farming. She hopes to make a good profit to support her business and expand her farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en: Sina, 43, is married and a mother of four children, one of whom is still in school. She lives in a village of the Sa Ang district, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice and growing cabbage for 20 years. This is the first cycle loan for Sina with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now she leads a group to ask for a loan of 170,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) each. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy some latrine materials for building a latrine such as cement, brick, toilet bowl, tile drainage, etc. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have good health and a good living standard condition.

loans.use: to buy some latrine materials for building a latrine

loans.name: Phep

texts.en: Phep, age 57 and a resident from Pursat province, is a mother of five children. To make a living, she grows corn, sesame, and jujube as her main sources of income. To supplement family income she sells grocery items and she has been involved with the current business for 11 years. Phep is the fifth client with VisionFund and has completely repaid back her loan. The past loan has helped her to run her business timely. Now she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) to buy crop seeds for her farming and use some portion to purchase grocery items to resell. She hopes to expand her farmland and grocery selling to make a good income to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy crop seeds for her farming

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en: A villager from a rural area located in the Siem Reap Province’s Srey Snom district, Srey is a 42-year old mother of four children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. She earns a living through farming rice as a main source of her income. She can earn about 11,600 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day from the current business and can save about 6,600 KHR each day for her future needs. This is the fifth cycle loan for Srey with VisionFund and she has successfully repaid back. The previous loan has helped her to improve her business and enabled her to keep her children in school. Now she is leading her group consisting of four members to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seed for her farmland and pay for the labor of plowing fee. She hopes to earn more crop yield from her rice paddy so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seed for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sriy's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sriy is aged 43 years old and married with two children. She earns a living through rice farming on four hectares of her farmland as the main source of her family’s income. Having been in this business for 23 years, she is able to earn about 30,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day to meet her family’s needs. Sriy’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. She is a fourth loan cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and has completely repaid back the previous loans. She has successfully used her last loan to support her family. Now she is seeking a loan of 700,000 KHR while another one group member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR from Visionfund. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farming. She hopes to earn more income to improve her living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farming

loans.name: Soun's Group

texts.en:
Soun, 44, is married and lives with her husband and six children in a village of the Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province. Out of her six children, she still has four who are still in school. 

She and her husband are rice farmers and they supplement their family’s income by selling sugar. The current business earns her about KHR 30,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Soun is just with VisionFund Cambodia this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for construction of a proper latrine. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials for construction of a proper latrine.

loans.name: Dong's Group

texts.en:
Dong, 41 years old, is a widowed mother of one daughter, living in a rural village of the Sa Ang district, Cambodia. To support her family, Dong has been farming for 21 years in the village. The current business earns her about KHR 20,000 per day.

Dong’s Group consists of four members who have never been with VisionFund Cambodia. Now, Dong is leading her group to apply for a loan. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials to construct a decent latrine. She'll need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, etc. 

Dong hopes that this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily consumption, to create a healthy standard of living.
,

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a decent latrine.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 30 years old. She lives with her three children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been selling fruit for many years; he sells seasonal fresh fruits in his hometown. He uses a four-wheel manual cart for selling--in this way as a hawker he is near the people and can easily be reached. The people like to buy fruit at their doors instead of moving to the market. Due to the fruit’s freshness he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation the demand for fruit has increased and his stock is finished by noon.

Shamim feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family. She is taking a loan for her husband so that her husband would be able to buy fruit in more quantity and equilibrium.
 
Shamim wants to save the excess profit amount so that she could utilize these saving for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit to sell.

loans.name: Roen's Group

texts.en:
A woman married living in a rural village located in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Roen is 49 years old and has four children but only one is dependent on her and still in school. 

Roen is a rice farmer who grows rice on a one-hectare of farmland.  She has been in this business for almost 30 years, earning about 24,000KHR, but is able to save about 10,000KHR each day.

Roen just joined VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. 

She hopes to earn more income from her current business to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Elvys Miguel

texts.es: El Sr. Elvys trabaja para una escuela publica desde hace mas de 7 años como maestro apoyando a niños y niñas de todas las edades, actualmente esta agradecido por el apoyo que le brindo ceprodel con este credito ya que lo necesitaba para realizarle una serie de examenes medico a su mama como ultrasonidos, compra de medicamentos y otros
texts.en: Elvys has been working as a teacher in a public school for more than 7 years, helping children of all  ages. At the moment he is grateful for the support of CEPRODEL for this loan as he needs it to do a series of medical exams on his chest such as ultrasounds, the purchase of medications etc...

loans.use: to do a series of medical exams on his chest(ultrasounds among others).

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 35-year-old married Iraqi woman. She has three children. She has an old machine and working as tailor to assists her husband in their family income. 

One of her children is a boy named Hussien who is a student. Every year, the family faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the study year because of the additional expenses that are needed to cover study fees and books. 

With this loan, he can accommodate all these expenses.

She is requesting a loan to pay for her son's school fees and other study expenses. Hussien's dream is to be a doctor. 

The story of Hussien is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients who are able to get better education.

loans.use: to pay for her son's school fees and other study expenses.

loans.name: Juana Anixia

texts.es:
La señora Juana ,es casada, trabaja en un poblado de la localidad, desempeñándose como maestra de educación  primaria con 16 años de laborar.
Esta señora tiene  su propio negocio, como es una librería, desde que inicio este negocio se ha caracterizado  por ser una persona muy esforzada. Una de las necesidades que atraviesa es de comprar productos para la ampliación de su librería,  como son Compra de útiles escolares para librería, cuadernos, selladores, tajadores, marcadores, cartones de escarche, estuche geométrico, reglas platicas, resmas de hojas de colores, fólderes, paleógrafo  etc. Es  por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para comprar los productos a sus proveedores y a si continuar comercializándolos y satisfacer la demanda de sus cliente, con el único fin de obtener mas  ingresos para mantener su hogar y brindarle mejores condiciones a su familia
texts.en:
Juana is married and works in a local village as a teacher, a job she has exercised for 16 years.
She has her own business, a bookstore. She has distinguished herself as a very hard-working woman. She needs to buy products to expand her bookstore, school supplies such as notebooks, seals, pencil sharpeners, markers, pencil cases, plastic rulers, reams of coloured paper, folders, etc. This is why she has come to Ceprodel in order to take out a loan for the purchase of products from her suppliers. This will allow her to continue selling these items and to satisfy her customers' demand. Her only goal is to obtain a greater income in order to maintain her household and provide her family with better conditions.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for a bookstore, such as notebooks, seals, pencil sharpeners, markers, ice packs, pencil cases, plastic rulers, reams of coloured paper, folders, etc.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Heang is 47 and married. Heang has been working as a paid construction worker while her husband is a motor-taxi driver. The current business earns her about 33,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Heang started with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000KHR to buy more chickens for raising, and build a chicken coop to earn additional income for her family. 

She hopes to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to raise and build a chicken coop.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 41 years old and from the small town of Kazreti. He is married and has two school-age children. The family runs a small scale agricultural business and cultivates the small plot of land where maize and red beans are grown. In addition, Zaza owns a calf and a dairy cow and his wife produces cheese with the received milk. The cheese is sold from their house.

The couple works hard to earn a living and give their children what they need.  As the existing funds are not enough to satisfy their needs, Zaza and his spouse decided to restart a trading business which was stopped due to financial problems. 

With the received loan, they will go to Turkey and purchase household items such as blankets, linens, etc.. to sell them among their community members. The prices are lower in Turkey than in Georgia, and as the Turkish border is not far from the district Zaza is living in, he will transport the items easily. 

Zaza hopes the business will be lucrative and increase his income gradually. He will develop the business with the support of his wife, and generate an income to improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase household items to sell.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is at the age of 52, living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mason buy profession. He has been constructing building and houses for 30 years. He is an expert in his art and has manufactured many beautiful buildings in his carrier. 

He uses tools such as brick, buttering, and pointing trowels, hammer, joiner, chisel, and level, which have become out of order. Her wants to buy new tools to continue his construction work, but he does not have sufficient amount to buy these tools.
 
Therefore, Allah Rakhi requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can be empowered to buy tools for construction.

Allah Rakhi says thank to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools such as brick, buttering , and pointing trowels, hammer, joiner, chisel, and level for construction work.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Les  8 femmes du groupe Benkadi  sont mariées à majorité monogame dans leurs ménages. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’djebougouni dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de riz, de beurre de karité, d’arachide et des habits pour les enfants. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Sadio (femme assise au milieu des assises dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  riz dans le village de N’djebougouni et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de riz chez son fournisseur à Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes. Madame Sadio espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de   27 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et pour augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en: The eight women in the Benkadi group are married and live mainly in monogamous households. On average they are 40 years old with three children. They all live in the village of N'djebougouni in the Segou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali) and met through neighbourhood activities, family, and their business contacts in the village. They sell rice, Shea butter, groundnuts, and children's clothing. Hoping to increase their trade, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and this is their second solidarity loan. Mrs. Sadio (the woman sitting in the middle of the front row in the photo), is an important rice seller in N'djebougouni and the surrounding area. She plans to use her loan to buy two bags of rice from her supplier in Segou. The resale is made for cash or credit from her home to her clientele of men and women. Mrs. Sadio hopes to make an average monthly profit of 27 000 FCFA with this loan, which she will use to provide for her children  and to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice.

loans.name: Santos Felicita

texts.es:
La Señora Santos Felicita trabaja en un kiosco como cocinera desde hace  6 años ubicado en la terminal de buses donde elabora riquísimos platillos, realiza este  trabajo para  apoyar  a su esposo en el sustento del hogar, es madre de 6 hijos. 

 La señora Santos Felicita sale se sus casa a las 5:00 am y llega  a sus centro de labores  a las  6:00 am finalizando a las 5:00 pm. 

La Señora Santos Felicita solicita este crédito a Ceprodel para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques, cemento, arena, el cual utilizara para mejorar las condiciones de su casa de habitación y brindarle a su familia una mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Señora Santos Felicita has worked at a kiosk as a cook for six years. The kiosk is located in the bus terminal. She makes delicious dishes, and works in order to support her husband in keeping up the household. She is mother to six children.
Santos Felicita leaves her home at 5:00 am and arrives at her workplace at 6:00 am. She finishes work at 5:00 pm.
She is requesting this loan from Ceprodel for the purchase of construction materials such as blocks, cement, and sand. She will use these to improve her home's conditions and offer her family better comfort.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Isidra De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Isidra de Jesús posee un negocio de venta de verduras, frutas en  unos de los mercados de la ciudad de león, se dedica a este negocio desde hace quince  años para el sustento de su familia ya que es madre soltera de tres hijos. 

La señora Isidra se traslada a su puesto de trabajo a las 5:00 am y abre su negocio a la 6 am finalizando a las 5:30 pm de lunes a sábado y el domingo hasta las 4:00 pm.  
 
El  crédito que  solicito a Ceprodel fue  utilizado para la compra al por mayor de mercadería tal como es: tomates, cebollas, bananas, entre otras y así obtener mayores  ganancias que le ayudara  a incrementar su inventario al igual que su clientela.
texts.en:
Isidra de Jesús owns a business selling vegetables and fruits in one of the markets in León, the city where she lives. She has been working in this business for 15 years to sustain her family, since she is a single mother of three children.

Isidra travels to her post at 5:00 am and opens her business at 6:00 am. She closes at 5:30 pm from Monday through Saturday, and at 4:00 pm on Sundays.
 
The loan that she requested from Ceprodel was used to purchase merchandise like tomatoes, onions, and bananas in bulk. This way, she will be able to obtain more revenue, which will help her to increase her inventory to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, and bananas.

loans.name: Taghrid

texts.en:
Taghrid, is a 24-year-old, married Iraqi woman. 

She started sewing in 2006; she bought a sewing machine to assist her husband in providing their family's income. She gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood, thanks to the quality of her work and her affordable prices.

Taghrid is requesting a loan to renovate her workplace, to expand her work and increase her production. She has one employee. She is aiming to grow her business and open a big place for sewing, so she will be able to create more jobs and help poor women that need a job. 

The story of Taghrid and her sewing business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development's clients .

loans.use: to renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Majid

texts.en:
Majid is a 35-year-old, married man and the father of three children. He has a car wash shop. One of his children is a boy named Ali. He is a student in primary school, and he gets high grades in school, every year. The family faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the study year, because of the additional expenses that must be covered, including study fees/tuition and books. With this loan, Majid can accommodate all these expenses.

Majid is requesting a loan to pay for his son's school fees and other study expenses. Ali's dream is to be an engineer. This loan will give him a chance to continue his studies and, hopefully, to fulfill that dream.

The story of Ali is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients, who are able to get a better education.

loans.use: to pay for his son's school and transportation expenses.

loans.name: Tariel

texts.en:
Tariel is 45 years old, married, and lives in the village of Darkveti with his wife and daughter. 

Tariel is a metal craftsman and he works at the local mine. He earns a small, monthly salary. In addition, Tariel leads the family agricultural business. Specifically, he owns cows, one pig, and he cultivates a plot of land where various kinds of vegetables are grown.  He works hard, but the earnings are not enough to satisfy the daily needs of the family. That’s why Tariel applied for the credit for restarting the coffee business which was stopped due to the financial problems. 

His loan request was approved through a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The program provides start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor. These people do not have access to traditional credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

Tariel requested a loan to purchase a coffee grinder. His wife will sell coffee and offer grinding services to local people. The couple plans to increase the turnover in the trade business gradually. This will raise the income of the family, which Tariel will use to improve the family’s living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a coffee grinder machine.

loans.name: Silvia Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Silvia es soltera, trabaja desempeñándose como maestra de educación primaria con 30 años de experiencia, la cual habita en una comarca de la localidad con su familia. Una de las necesidades que  atraviesa es la urgencia de mejorar su vivienda ya que se encuentra en mal estado, ya que nos encontramos en periodo lluvioso. Por tal razón se presento a la  oficina de ceprodel para  solicitar un financiamiento para llevar  a cabo dicha obra y lo utilizaría en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: cemento, arena, bloques, zinc, piedrín y pago de mano de obra y de esta manera darle mejores condiciones a su familia.
Es necesario destacar que desde que Ceprodel le ha brindado créditos ha venido mejorando su nivel de vida. Actualmente su record crediticio es de 3 creditos
texts.en:
Silvia is a single woman. She has 30 years of experience working as a primary school teacher. She lives in a region with her family.

She urgently needs to improve her home, since it is in a poor state because the region is experiencing a rainy season. For this reason, she came to the Ceprodel office to request a loan to start work on this project. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials like cement, sand, cinderblocks, zinc, and gravel, and to pay laborers. This way, she will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

It is necessary to note that, since she has been receiving loans from Ceprodel, her quality of life has improved. She has had three loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, sand, cinderblocks, zinc, and gravel, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy meat and fish, to resell to customers in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Tornike

texts.en:
Tornike is 23 years old. He lives with his parents and brother in the small village of Baghdati district. His mother works at a local kindergarten and gets a small, monthly income. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milking cows and they produce dairy products to sell. In addition, they have a vineyard and they produce and sell wine. 

In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living.  So, Tornike decided to start his own business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. His credit requests were rejected several times since he was unable to satisfy their requirements. 

Tornike received a credit in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up program gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start their businesses.  

With the loan of GEL 7,000, Tornike will build a greenhouse and grow cucumbers and tomatoes there. He will purchase the seeds and all the building materials to build a greenhouse. He will sell the harvested products locally, at a good price. This will increase the income of his family. With increased income, they will be able to improve the living conditions of their family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal is a 41-year-old mother of four children, two of whom are still in school. She comes from a rural village of Pursat province’s Bakan district.  She and her husband have been farming rice on almost two hectares of farmland. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Sophal has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. The previous loan helped her to support her family better. She is now applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR, which she will use to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. She hopes to grow more rice, so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta is 61 year old and she lives in Kapan. Greta is a widow and she has three daughters. All of them are married and they live separately. Greta has studied at the Kapan Medical College and has a specialty as a midwife but she has never worked in this specialty. 

For some time she has worked at the shoe making factory and now she is engaged in a clothes trading business at the Kapan wholesale market. She sells men and women's clothes, underwear, and children and teenager's clothes.
 
Great asks a loan of 250.000 Armenian drams to buy clothing for school-aged children to resell since the beginning of the new academic year is very close. She hopes to have a good income from this season's sales.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Jenifer José

texts.es: Jennifer es una mujer casada tiene 1 hijo, su marido trabaja en una empresa del sector donde vive, ella se dedica a la actividad comercial como es la venta de fritanga por las tardes, de la que tiene 8 años de ejercerla, este cliente los que combina con los ingresos que su marido le ayuda y los ingresos de su actividad comercial de la que dedica un porcentaje para efectuar dichas mejoras , actualmente está solicitando un financiamiento para continuar con las obras de su vivienda  y lo utilizara en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como, cemento, arena, piedrín cerámica,  bondex, fragua., ya que los financiamientos que solicita son pequeños y de esa manera ha ido mejorando sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Jennifer is married with one child. Her husband works for a local company. She is a merchant and sells fried food in the afternoons. She has been doing this for eight years. She combines her income with her husband's income. She dedicates a percentage to making improvements. She is now requesting a loan in order to continue working on her home. She will use it to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, ceramic blocks, Bondex, and metal items. Her loans are small and she has been able to use them to improve her conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, ceramic blocks, Bondex, and metal items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials, sand, cement, blocks, iron, purlins, zinc and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Gift Keko Flat Group

texts.en:
Hilda, who is in her late 30s, is married and has three children. Two of her children attend school, while the third is still too young for school. For seven years now, Hilda has been managing her life expenses by running a shop selling food like baking flour, maize flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc. Hilda is doing great in her business. She works from 7:00am to 10:00pm daily and is able to earn a good living each month.

This is Hilda’s tenth loan request from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to start selling home utensils like plates, bowls, and different kinds of spoons. She also used loans to restock more food items for her shop. Hilda has paid back all of her previous loans successfully. With the profit she earned, she bought a plot of land where she built a house, and she paid school fees and home expenses. Hilda will use this loan to restock more utensils. She dreams that one day she will be able to own a wholesale business selling cold drinks. 

Hilda will share this loan with her loan group "Gift Keko” which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy utensils to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Mwanauba

texts.en:
Mwanauba appreciates for her previous loan that improved her living standards.It enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. 

She is requesting for a loan of ksh.10,000 to purchase more fish for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with children and three of them go to school. He started a retail shop in 2010 with the idea of having a clear source of income. He gives the business an average of 10 hours per day and his business is located in the Katura –Mashonga-Kyamuhunga-Bushenyi District. He has applied for a loan of ugx.2.000.000 (Two million shillings) so he will be able to buy more merchandise to put in his shop. 

George’s daily customers are the local people in the area and he strongly believes that the profits he will get from the business will help a lot in educating his children. He describes himself as a shrewd and vigilant business man who is ready and willing to achieve his set goals in life despite the big challenge of lack of capital which he is facing at the moment.

loans.use: To buy retail stock to sell

loans.name: Qusai

texts.en:
Qusai is a 28-year-old, married man, and the father of one child. He has been working in the agriculture sector for nine years. Qusai is a hard worker; he specializes in growing date palm trees and selling dates. He takes good care of his farm and gets the best quality dates, in order to obtain better prices for his production.

Qusai  will use this loan to purchase organic fertilizer and a water pump. He expects that the loan will generate additional income, which will enable him to develop his farm and build a cattle farm.

The story of Qusai and his farm is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients, who have been able to improve their green areas.

loans.use: to buy necessary organic fertilizers and a water pump.

loans.name: Archil

texts.en:
Archil is 51 years old and widowed. He is living with his two grown sons in the town of Kutaisi. Archil and his younger son are both jobless at the moment. The only one who makes money in the household is Archil’s elder son who is working for a local distribution company. He gets a small monthly salary which is hardly enough to cover every day costs. 

There is a high unemployment rate in the region and Archil has been unable to find a suitable job. Recently though he found that the Tourist Agency needed a driver. 

Archil has applied for the job and he has been hired, but he is required to use his own car. That’s why Archil needs financial support. With the startup loan, Archil will buy a secondhand car that he can use to serve the tourists. He will earn a monthly income and improve his living conditions. He awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a car to serve his tourist agency

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 30 years old and she is already a very successful businesswoman. She lives in Yerevan with her brother and sister, in a rented flat. 

Now, she works at the Yerevan wholesale market, in the department of jewelry sales, where she has rented a stall. She works alone and she sells very nice jewelry, made of gold (e.g., rings, sets, necklaces, bracelets, earrings, and pendants, such as crosses and designs in the form of different animals).

The jewelry that she sells, she orders and buys from several particular jewelers, several times during the month. She is not married and she has much time to spend on her business. That is why the business is striving and she is very much satisfied. 

This is Mariam's second deal with Kiva and she hopes to deserve her lenders' support again. This time, Mariam asks a loan of USD 3,000 to enlarge her stall assortment and, in this way, receive good income, both for her living and for her new orders of more expensive jewelry.

loans.use: to enlarge her stall assortment of jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana is a 56-year-old, married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has six children. The youngest child is 12. 

Valeriana raises and sells hogs. Her husband is a farmer. She requested a loan  of PHP 11,000 to buy an additional piglet and pig feed. 

In the future, Valeriana would like to expand her hog-raising business to support the education of her children and a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy an additional piglet and pig feed.

loans.name: Nhanh's Group

texts.en:
Nhanh is aged 37 and married. She has four children, one of whom is still in school. She and her family live in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. To make a living, her husband has been working as an electrician for 10 years. To add more income, they also run a business as a motorbike washer, in the village. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day, to meet the family’s needs.
 
Nhanh is just with VisionFund this loan cycle, and she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy supplies to use in washing motorcycles. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase the income from her current business, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy supplies to use in washing motorcycles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cleaning detergents, cleaning brushes and brooms.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en: Micheal is 23 years old and is in the goat trading business, which he started in the year 2011. He started goat trading so he could be able to get a stable source of income. Micheal buys and sells goats in his local area in Nyakishojwa-Nkinga-Ruhinda in Mitooma District and he gives the business an average of five hours per day. His clients are mainly goat traders in the same locality. He hopes to use the loan money of UGX 1,000,000 to buy more goats, which he will sell at a profit. He strongly believes that he will be financially stable with time. He says his major challenge is lack of enough capital, which he hopes will be no more if he is given future loans.

loans.use: To buy baby goats

loans.name: Fotemaban Group

texts.fr: Les dix  femmes du groupe Fotemaban sont mariées à majorité polygames dans leurs ménages. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Benzana dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de la Farine et du bois .Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2emecycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Fatoumata  (2eme  femme assise de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité suffisante de farine de blé chez son fournisseur  à Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant  au marché et  à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes. Madame Fatoumata    espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 15 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The ten women of the Fotemaban Group are married women, living for the most part in polygamous households. They have an average age of 36 years and and average of four children. They all live in the village of Benzana in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of vicinity, kinship and through their small businesses in the village. They are merchants of wood and flour.With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Fatoumata (shown sitting second from the right in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of wheat flour from her supplier in Ségou. She resells her merchandise for cash, both at the market and from her home, to a clientele composed of men and women. Fatoumata hopes to earn an average monthly income of 15,000 Francs CFA with this loan, which will be used to pay for the children's needs.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is 30 years old and lives with his family in Siptak city, which is in the Lori region. He lives with his retired parents, wife, and two small sons. Harutyun has the higher education of an economist. For several years he has worked as a director of the house of culture in their city. Now Harutyun works at the Debed Hydro Power Plant as an inspector. Very recently Harutyun repaired his house, but he has a great problem connected with the heating of his house, since all the windows are old and worn out and they need to be changed. Only in this way will it be able to keep in the warmth of the house. 

Harutyun asks for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams (AMD) to buy and change the windows of his house to provide his family members with a warm and comfortable winter.

loans.use: To buy and change the windows of his house to provide his family members with a warm and comfortable winter

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr: Les cinq  femmes du groupe Djiguiya sont mariées à majorité monogame dans leurs ménages. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Benzana dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce  du bois et de charbons.Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2eme  cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Salimata (femme assise à l’extrème gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  charbons   dans le village de Benzana et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 sacs de charbons chez les bucherons du village. La revente se fait au comptant  au marché et  à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes. Madame Salimata  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  6 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The five women in the Djiguiya Group are married, living for the most part in monogamous households. They are an average of 32 years old and have an average of five children each. They all live in the village of Benzana in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of vicinity, kinship and through their small businesses in the village. They are merchants of firewood and charcoal. With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Salimata (shown sitting on the far left in the photo) is a large seller of charcoal in the village of Benzana and its surrounding area. She plans to use her loan to buy six bags of charcoal from the village loggers. She resells her merchandise for cash, both at the market and from her home, to a clientele composed of men and women. Salimata hopes to earn an average monthly income of 6,000 Francs CFA with this loan, which will be used to pay for the children's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Akwesi

texts.en: Although he has received no prior formal education, Akwesi is an entrepreneur. He specializes in bicycle repair in Domenase (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for 15 years. Akwesi is married and has 3 children. His wife works as a petty trader. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Akwesi wants to use his loan to increase his current inventory levels, thereby allowing him to expand his bicycle repair business. In the long term, Akwesi plans to reinvest future profits into his business, thus helping him expand and meet the rising demands of his customers.

loans.use: to increase his current inventory levels, thereby allowing him to expand his bicycle repair business.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr: Les dix  femmes du groupe Danaya sont mariées à majorité monogame dans leurs ménages. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’djebougouni dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de  farine, du riz, et d’arachide .Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Hawa (femme assise à l’extrème droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  pâté et de friture de farine de blé  dans le village de N’djebougouni et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 65kg de farine chez son fournisseur à  Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant  au marché et  à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes. Madame Hawa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  10 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Danaya group are women who are married mainly in monogamous households. They average 32 years of age and 4 children each, and they all live in the village of N’djebougouni, region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali). They know one another as neighbors, through ties of kinship, and through the small trade activities they conduct in the village. They sell flour, rice and groundnuts. 

To bolster their working capital, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their 1st group loan with the MFI. Mrs. Hawa (sitting at the far right in the photo) is a top seller of pâté and wheat flour fritters in N’djebougouni and its surroundings. She plans to use her loan to buy 65kg of flour from her supplier in Ségou. She sells her products for cash, at the market and from her home, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Mrs. Hawa hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA, which she will use to provide for the children’s needs.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour.

loans.name: Mlimani Group

texts.en:
Said, who is in his early 30s, is married and lives with her wife. They have been blessed with a child. Since 2011, Said has been running a barber shop.  He works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. every working day. Through these long hours, he is able to make a very small profit per month.  

This will be Said’s second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used his previous loan to buy barber shop hair cutting equipment and other barber supplies. Said has paid back his entire previous loan successfully. With the business profit received, he managed to cover home expenses.  He will use this loan to open a beauty salon for his wife. Said dreams that one day he will be able to build a house.  

He will share this loan with his loan group” Mlimani” which totals 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a beauty salon for his wife.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri, 24, is single and lives with his parents, pensioner grandmother, and married brother with two children. He is a very energetic and enthusiastic young man, working as a cashier operator at the hock-shop. He gets a small monthly income. Badri’s parents work at the local cleaning company for modest wages in return.

Badri wants to generate more income, so he decided to start up a grocery store but found that he didn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for the credit to MFO Credo, and his loan request was approved under the framework of a startup project. With a loan of 1,500 USD Badri will purchase all the needed building materials to construct a grocery store in his town. After the store is built, Badri’s business partner will purchase basic groceries for starting it up. They will work together and share the received profit. Badri hopes that his business initiative will be lucrative and help his family in covering food and everyday expenses. Badri awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a store

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is 45 years old and is a hard-working man. He lives in the village Debed in Lori region. He is married and has three sons. The elder son is on military service and other two are still school-aged. His wife does not work outside the home and together they manage to take care of their farm. They have four cows, two bulls, a piglet and a lot of chickens. In summer months, Suren keeps his farm cattle in the village's nearby pastures. In all these of activities, his wife and two sons help him greatly. For animal fodder, Suren uses the hay that he mows himself. But for winter months, the hay is not enough for the cattle to be fed. 
Suren asks for a loan of 300.000 Armenian drams to buy animal fodder for winter months such as grass, barley and wheat.

loans.use: To buy animal fodder for winter months such as grass, barley and wheat

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is married with one child, aged 15. He has been a rice farmer for the past five years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizer for use during rice production. Profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use in rice production.

loans.name: Kokadje Group

texts.fr: Les six  femmes du groupe Kokadje sont mariées à majorité monogames dans leurs ménages. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’djebougouni dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de condiments, de calebasse et du riz .Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2emecycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Balakissa  (2ème   femme arretée à  gauche vers la droite  dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  condiment de tout genre   dans le village de N’djebougouni et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité suffisante de condiments oignons, huile, ail, tomate, aubergine et sel de cuisine  chez son fournisseur  à Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant  au marché et  à domicile à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Balakissa    espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
The six women of the Kokadje Group are married, living for the most part in monogamous households. They have an average age of 43 years and and average of four children. They are living in the village of N’djebougouni in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of vicinity, kinship and through their small businesses in the village. They are merchants of condiments (vegetable-based sauces), calabash gourds, and rice. With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Balakissa (shown standing second from the left in the photo) is a great merchant of condiments (vegetable-based sauces) of every type in the village of N'djebougouni and its surrounding areas. She plans to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of ingredients for condiments: onions, oil, garlic, tomatoes, eggplants and salt, from her supplier in Ségou. She resells her merchandise for cash, both at the market and from her home, to a clientele composed mainly of women. Balakissa hopes to earn an average monthly income of 20,000 Francs CFA with this loan, which will be used to pay for the children's needs and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase a sufficient quantity of ingredients for condiments (vegetable-based sauces): onions, oil, garlic, tomatoes, eggplants and salt.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en: Nyevu is 50 years old, married and a mother of three children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables from her food kiosk in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of about KES 6,350 from the business. Nyevu was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her second loan of KES 30,000, to buy additional stock for her kiosk such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges and onions to sell to customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as continue expanding the business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that she may assist in uplifting her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is 40 years old and he lives with his family in Vanadzor city. He is married and has a small son. For 10 years, Mher has worked as a taxi driver using his own car. He mainly drives to Yerevan-Vanadzor and Vanadzor-Georgia and he has a lot of customers. They prefer to travel such far distances in his taxi since he drives attentively and very carefully.
Mher asks a loan 500.000 Armenian drams to do some repairing on his car since on some parts of his car, metal is seriously damaged.

loans.use: To do some repairing on his car since on some parts of his car, metal is seriously damaged

loans.name: Fortunne

texts.en:
Fortunne is 39 years old. She is married with four children aged between six and eleven. She has been a rice farmer for 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers for use during rice production. The profits from the produce will be used to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use in rice production for better output

loans.name: Jean Nepo

texts.en:
Jean Nepo is 35 years old.  He is married, with two children aged between three and thirteen. His wife works as a farmer, and they have spent more than 15 years farming. 

Jean Nepo will use the loan to buy fertilizer.  The profits from the produce will be used to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to agricultural activities as high risk because the profitability of these activities is so affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.  For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions.
